Add tempest GLARE sanity check tests

This commit adds very basic api tests for glare artifact type for murano

tempest artifact client.

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-20 17:25:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py'], 'message': "Fix CinderPersistentObject.refresh

Currently our refresh method is not working as it should as it has
mainly 3 problems:

- It doesn't support read_only fields
- It may trigger lazy loads
- It will not respect version-fields relationships

The read_only issue is triggered when we do a refresh from the DB and
the field has changed.  This could be the case of a metadata field that
is loaded by `get_by_id` but it is not allowed to be modified directly
in the OVO:

    oslo_versionedobjects.exception.ReadOnlyFieldError: Cannot modify
    readonly field name

The triggering of lazy loads would occur if we have an OVO that has an
optional field set and we do a refresh.  This refresh would trigger the
lazy load of that field.

A case where the old refresh would not respect version-fields
relationships is for example when you receive in a node with volume v1.1
and CG v1.1 a volume v1.0 that has CG v1.0, then you do a refresh and
you end up with a volume with v1.0 and CG v1.1.  And this gets even
worse if any of your fields changed the stored contents on a field and
relied on backporting to do the right mapping, as now we'll have the old
OVO version with the new OVO contents.

This patch refactors refresh method in a way that fixes the first 2
problems as it has been deemed that proposed solution for the third
issue would add too much complexity and it's more likely unnecessary.

Closes-Bug: #1599502
Change-Id: Ibcb0f841d92ab7f96c076fba4569c56734e91ffd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CinderPersistentObject.refresh

Currently our refresh method is not working as it should as it has
mainly 3 problems:

- It doesn't support read_only fields
- It may trigger lazy loads
- It will not respect version-fields relationships

The read_only issue is triggered when we do a refresh from the DB and
the field has changed.  This could be the case of a metadata field that
is loaded by `get_by_id` but it is not allowed to be modified directly
in the OVO:

    oslo_versionedobjects.exception.ReadOnlyFieldError: Cannot modify
    readonly field name

The triggering of lazy loads would occur if we have an OVO that has an
optional field set and we do a refresh.  This refresh would trigger the
lazy load of that field.

A case where the old refresh would not respect version-fields
relationships is for example when you receive in a node with volume v1.1
and CG v1.1 a volume v1.0 that has CG v1.0, then you do a refresh and
you end up with a volume with v1.0 and CG v1.1.  And this gets even
worse if any of your fields changed the stored contents on a field and
relied on backporting to do the right mapping, as now we'll have the old
OVO version with the new OVO contents.

This patch refactors refresh method in a way that fixes the first 2
problems as it has been deemed that proposed solution for the third
issue would add too much complexity and it's more likely unnecessary.

Closes-Bug: #1599502
Change-Id: Ibcb0f841d92ab7f96c076fba4569c56734e91ffd

commit_message:
[kubernetes] Create actions to recreate pods and restart containers

This patch adds actions to KubernetesPod class which allow to
recreate a pod (delete it and create new one) and to restart docker
containers on minion nodes.

Change-Id: Ia03b27d72662700fb302960adba9dae20203b597
Closes-bug: #1466359
(cherry picked from commit 92238f78c873cfada8befbf0afd8bb35e16ed28d)

commit_message:
[k8s] Save gateway node ip before its release for proper reporting

During scaling gateways down, reporter was trying to get ip of the
instance which was already released and that caused index error.
This patch saves this ip for report before releasing resourses.

Change-Id: I9310a423b1ad8c488c1cc7400844ae5d8767879c
Closes-bug: #1590728
(cherry picked from commit 3c393ba7c6e63c93018ffa7f422ee9a7ceb5fbce)

commit_message:
Adds gate-neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-scenario-namespace-nv

haproxy in namespace is still supported[1] as a neutron-lbaas driver.
To keep it healthy we should have some scenario tests to verify it's
functionality.

Recent example, described in bug 1603860, shows that gating on API tests is
not enough.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1565801/comments/9

Change-Id: I652ce8974c2f643f832043ad9c0e0325587ec725
Related-Bug: #1603860

commit_message:
Added version parameter to nodejs jobs

Javascript jobs may now set the version of nodejs they'd like to
run via a parameter in the job's name. This will permit easier
migration to later versions of nodejs.

Change-Id: Id58f8475763f4855b7f5da8c242058bc519a2381

subject: Complete proxy support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-24 05:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/config/localrc', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-14.04-server-amd64.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/netboot/preseed-ssh-v4.cfg', 'labs/osbash/scripts/pre-download.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/lib.ubuntu-14.04-server-i386.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh'], 'message': 'Complete proxy support

The current proxy support in osbash can only be used to speed up the
process. This patch improves the existing code which allows osbash to
build the basedisk in environments where an HTTP proxy is the only
Internet connection available.

To use it, set the VM_PROXY variable in config/localrc.

The patch adds a new preseed file that does not require an HTTPS
connection during the operating system installation.

Partial-Bug: #1602272
Change-Id: I89a7539292bd034c1b87013e8b2bc68777726601
'}]
commit_message:
Complete proxy support

The current proxy support in osbash can only be used to speed up the
process. This patch improves the existing code which allows osbash to
build the basedisk in environments where an HTTP proxy is the only
Internet connection available.

To use it, set the VM_PROXY variable in config/localrc.

The patch adds a new preseed file that does not require an HTTPS
connection during the operating system installation.

Partial-Bug: #1602272
Change-Id: I89a7539292bd034c1b87013e8b2bc68777726601

subject: Install Ansible from pypi instead of from a git clone
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-21 13:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Install Ansible from pypi instead of from a git clone

This patch removes the git clone machinary and sets the Ansible
installation to happen from pypi by default. The ANSIBLE_PACKAGE
environment variable can still be used to change the install to
use a git source if the deployer wishes to do so.

This change is implemented to remove another moving part from
the Ansible bootstrap process, allowing a pypi/wheel mirror to
be used instead.

Change-Id: I137956530a11b0b23adb41f6b38dd55cde892221
'}]
commit_message:
Install Ansible from pypi instead of from a git clone

This patch removes the git clone machinary and sets the Ansible
installation to happen from pypi by default. The ANSIBLE_PACKAGE
environment variable can still be used to change the install to
use a git source if the deployer wishes to do so.

This change is implemented to remove another moving part from
the Ansible bootstrap process, allowing a pypi/wheel mirror to
be used instead.

Change-Id: I137956530a11b0b23adb41f6b38dd55cde892221

Currently, dns nameservers will be empty when creating subnets
without option named "dns_nameservers".

But in many situations, users want to get default dns nameservers
and not specify any dns nameservers.

This patch provides default dns nameservers when creating subnets

Change-Id: I34125cca77a39839d0f74a269779804d78b31267

commit_message:
Using default dns nameservers when creates subnet

Currently, dns nameservers will be empty when creating subnets
without option named "dns_nameservers".

But in many situations, users want to get default dns nameservers
and not specify any dns nameservers.

This patch provides default dns nameservers when creating subnets
if not specify dns dnsnameservers.

Change-Id: I34125cca77a39839d0f74a269779804d78b31267

commit_message:
Increase the max zaqar messages size to 2^19

This increases the max zaqar message size to 524288. This
is required to use Zaqar as a config transport for t-h-t.

Depends-On: I07a8b3c659a367f65b9d4cd700912a419e50a472

commit_message:
XtremIO: support of snapshot manage commands

As snapshots are volumes in XtremIO, all this change does is route
the snapshot manage calls to the appropriate volume manage calls.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I90432ace52d9c8b7ae48c843be86c1d51e8c875e
Implements: blueprint xtremio-manage-snapshot

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-21 20:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/authtoken-e83781cebdc8ea4c.yaml', 'spec/acceptance/basic_designate_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/designate_api_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Configure keystone authtoken options

Update designate::api to leverage keystone::resource::authtoken to
configure the keystone middleware. This patch also allows designate to
be able to leverage Keystone v3.

Some deprecations:
- designate::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::project_name.
- designate::api::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::username.
- designate::api::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::password.
- designate::api::keystone_host, designate::api::keystone_port,
  designate::api::keystone_protocol are deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::auth_uri and designate::api_auth_url.
- designate::api::keystone_memcached_servers is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::memcached_servers.

The patch is backward compatible.

Change-Id: I2cb4076b3e8679adac2722871f8391e750e8b4b0
Closes-Bug: #1604463
'}]
commit_message:
Configure keystone authtoken options

Update designate::api to leverage keystone::resource::authtoken to
configure the keystone middleware. This patch also allows designate to
be able to leverage Keystone v3.

Some deprecations:
- designate::api::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::project_name.
- designate::api::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::username.
- designate::api::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::password.
- designate::api::keystone_host, designate::api::keystone_port,
  designate::api::keystone_protocol are deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::auth_uri and designate::api_auth_url.
- designate::api::keystone_memcached_servers is deprecated in favor of
  designate::api::memcached_servers.

The patch is backward compatible.

Change-Id: I2cb4076b3e8679adac2722871f8391e750e8b4b0
Closes-Bug: #1604463

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-12 03:20:03.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': 'Fix wrong path used in iscsi "multipath -l"

When iSCSI multipath device path was not found via LUN wwn,
os-brick would use device path like below:
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.52:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.apm00153906536.b5-lun-155
to detch multipath id via 'multipath -l'.
This causes error: "can't get udev device"

This fix will use path like '/dev/sda' to discover mpath id.

Change-Id: I1177d846a9f6f28b2276aae2ff91af9d4ea5849e
Closes-bug: #1585940
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong path used in iscsi "multipath -l"

When iSCSI multipath device path was not found via LUN wwn,
os-brick would use device path like below:
/dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.168.3.52:3260-iscsi-iqn.1992-04.com.emc:cx.apm00153906536.b5-lun-155
to detch multipath id via 'multipath -l'.
This causes error: "can't get udev device"

This fix will use path like '/dev/sda' to discover mpath id.

Change-Id: I1177d846a9f6f28b2276aae2ff91af9d4ea5849e
Closes-bug: #1585940

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 21:44:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py'], 'message': 'Dell SC: Specify High Availability for create replication

No SyncMode was being specified. This defaults the SyncMode to
High Consistency. This patch changes it to High Availability.

Change-Id: Idaa8f4f9a4d1914da99caeb8a49e4740e4d9e68b
Closes-Bug: #1596680
(cherry picked from commit 70b039cfe6c20f90189b51e9a03753c15bd3a4af)
'}]
commit_message:
Dell SC: Specify High Availability for create replication

No SyncMode was being specified. This defaults the SyncMode to
High Consistency. This patch changes it to High Availability.

Change-Id: Idaa8f4f9a4d1914da99caeb8a49e4740e4d9e68b
Closes-Bug: #1596680
(cherry picked from commit 70b039cfe6c20f90189b51e9a03753c15bd3a4af)

commit_message:
Disable action buttons according to the statuses of environments

In environments list view, action buttons are only clickable if
all checked environments have appropriate status to run this
action.
Page reload after environment status change is added to refresh
displayed buttons.
Selenium tests to check buttons availability are added.

Change-Id: Iae50fb87697c3fa745e412f1cab50dc0da9d981b
Closes-bug: #1593292

subject: Disable ansible retry files
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-23 10:37:07.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/ansible.cfg'], 'message': 'Disable ansible retry files

Currently the ansible retry files generated on failure are being saved
in the playbooks execution directory which is the new default in Ansible
"2.x". Because retry files generally do not work due to tag and task
execution issues that can come from over limiting and the fact that they
pollute the git tree the ansible retry files option has been disabled.

Change-Id: Idb4e0bd57aa2f7d6dff0277f2ffcc53905638295
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Disable ansible retry files

Currently the ansible retry files generated on failure are being saved
in the playbooks execution directory which is the new default in Ansible
"2.x". Because retry files generally do not work due to tag and task
execution issues that can come from over limiting and the fact that they
pollute the git tree the ansible retry files option has been disabled.

Change-Id: Idb4e0bd57aa2f7d6dff0277f2ffcc53905638295
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-23 10:40:30.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_ssl_configuration.yml'], 'message': "Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9
the task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Separate the task deploying a user provided ssl cert and key into
two and check them individually for 'haproxy_user_ssl_cert' or
'haproxy_user_ssl_key' being defined.

Change-Id: I75367fe25d15d35ff60203b7c1d78437d613404d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9
the task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Separate the task deploying a user provided ssl cert and key into
two and check them individually for 'haproxy_user_ssl_cert' or
'haproxy_user_ssl_key' being defined.

Change-Id: I75367fe25d15d35ff60203b7c1d78437d613404d

 * Option "rpc_backend" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal

 * Option "os_endpoint_type" from group "service_credentials" is deprecated.
   Use option "interface" from group "service_credentials".

 * Option "os_region_name" from group "service_credentials" is deprecated.
   Use option "region-name" from group "service_credentials".

subject: Optimise pip install tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-23 10:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/utility-install.yml'], 'message': 'Optimise pip install tasks

Unlike the Ansible apt module, the Ansible pip module does not
recognise a with_items list and process all the items at once.

To optimise the pip install tasks, this patch replaces the use
of with_items with a join filter so that the pip install task
does an install with all the packages in a list, ensuring that
the execution is one action instead of many.

Change-Id: Iee697a868e52bd5851864406e66fa3d58c7379a6
'}]
commit_message:
Optimise pip install tasks

Unlike the Ansible apt module, the Ansible pip module does not
recognise a with_items list and process all the items at once.

To optimise the pip install tasks, this patch replaces the use
of with_items with a join filter so that the pip install task
does an install with all the packages in a list, ensuring that
the execution is one action instead of many.

Change-Id: Iee697a868e52bd5851864406e66fa3d58c7379a6

subject: Change pip install task state to 'latest'
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-23 10:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/utility-install.yml'], 'message': "Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620
Change-Id: I6b6464d517497e461505f64dfd7256baff995653
"}]
commit_message:
Change pip install task state to 'latest'

Currently all pip install tasks only require the package to be
present. This means that when an environment undergoes a minor
upgrade the package is not upgraded to the same version that
was tested with. This ultimately results in a deployed
environment that does not match the tested environment.

While for the services installed into venvs this is not an
issue, it does affect those which do not use venvs and any
packages which are installed outside of a venv or on top
of a venv.

This patch changes the behaviour to ensure that the install
task will always use the latest available package. In
developer_mode this will mean using the version specified
in upper-constraints, and in an integrated build this will
mean the version which is available in the wheel repo's
folder for the tag.

Related-Bug: 1596620
Change-Id: I6b6464d517497e461505f64dfd7256baff995653

commit_message:
Move UCA repo URL var to role defaults

In order to expose the var in role documentation and to allow the use
of dynamically set facts to override the value in CI environments the
variable is moved from the role vars to the role defaults.

The uca_openstack_release var is also changed for Ubuntu 16.04 to
'newton' in order to match the current cycle appropriately. A note is
added to the Ubuntu 14.04 vars to make it clear that there will never
be a Newton UCA release for Trusty.

A small correction to the task description which sets the URL for the
AIO build in OpenStack-CI is also made to be more accurate.

Change-Id: I35b8e99e6e3f127ca507907d6480542b91a4107d

subject: Dynamically determine whether ceilometer should be enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-23 09:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/glance_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/nova_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/keystone_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/cinder_all.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/heat_all.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/dynamic-ceilometer-enablement-18be0bb994ede62a.yaml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/swift_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/neutron_all.yml'], 'message': "Dynamically determine whether ceilometer should be enabled

Currently each service requires a var to be set to enable the
configuration of ceilometer for the service.

This patch makes this setting dynamic based on whether there
are any hosts in the ceilometer_all host group.

This reduces the amount of configuration required for an
environment, making OSA simpler to use.

The 'rabbitmq_servers' group_var was previously a list of
'host:port' combinations. It is now only a set of hosts.

The new 'transport_url' configuration option for oslo_messaging
is not working with SSL enabled, so SSL transport for RabbitMQ
has been temporarily disabled.

Change-Id: Ia5ba4e26b9adcfd923a93c6ea5077cbec0c4478d
"}]
commit_message:
Dynamically determine whether ceilometer should be enabled

Currently each service requires a var to be set to enable the
configuration of ceilometer for the service.

This patch makes this setting dynamic based on whether there
are any hosts in the ceilometer_all host group.

This reduces the amount of configuration required for an
environment, making OSA simpler to use.

The 'rabbitmq_servers' group_var was previously a list of
'host:port' combinations. It is now only a set of hosts.

The new 'transport_url' configuration option for oslo_messaging
is not working with SSL enabled, so SSL transport for RabbitMQ
has been temporarily disabled.

Change-Id: Ia5ba4e26b9adcfd923a93c6ea5077cbec0c4478d

commit_message:
Implement Basic Performance Monitoring

Added telegraf container for metric collection

Added influxdb container for metric storage by default deployed to a
separate node type.

Telegraf and influxdb are controllable via
enable_performance_monitoring flag

Added Grafana when enable_grafana is set to "yes"

Change-Id: Ib8451f432833f0c676b50a2c58d5fb2b2f7cc6bf
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-monitoring

commit_message:
Reorganize test playbooks

The following changes have been made to reorganize the structure of this
role's test playbooks, bringing them into line with other
OpenStack-Ansible roles:
  - move each playbook to an individual file
  - rename playbooks descriptively
  - define hosts and groups directly in the inventory file
  - include group and test vars required by containers
  - create a separate bridge, br-mgmt, for the management network
    interface of containers
  - enable verbose logging for functional test output

Change-Id: Idfdae98a423e19a1ed0eb05ab3d0f497b9fbeaaf
(cherry picked from commit bceaaae011a2d0513d75cc9b58cb30a2abc66f69)

commit_message:
Fix setting of upper_constraints fact

The pip_constraint_update filter overrides pip versions from the second
provided list to the first. Update the 'Set upper constraints' task so
that upper-constraints correctly take priority over the local
requirements packages versions.

A test has been included to validate that the role built package
constraints file is correctly applying the upper-constraints from the
openstack requirements repo.

Closes-Bug: 1605846
Change-Id: I53864a34f3ba56a84ed658fa3952aba3c509e0b1

commit_message:
Add Watcher ansible roles and templates

Previous work on Watcher added the Docker images, this
change adds the ansible configuration.

There is support for HA, via haproxy to balance across the
Watcher API hosts.

There is also a hook into nova.conf to conditionally add
Nova compute Host metrics via Ceilometer if Watcher is enabled.

This defaults to enabled false.

Change-Id: I8763528bb6ff12943b810212c71396d2d7cf6836
Partial-bug: #1598929
Partially-implements: bp watcher
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

subject: Add check to keep users from running osbash as root
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-16 12:40:13.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/osbash.sh'], 'message': 'Add check to keep users from running osbash as root

Running osbash as root or using sudo is not necessary and can lead to
unexpected behavior (e.g., "invisible" VMs owned by root rather than
the user).

With this patch, osbash complains and aborts if it run as root.

Change-Id: I08367980a78012e1aed21fde7ca7fb6408fd5933
Partial-Bug: #1602272
'}]
commit_message:
Add check to keep users from running osbash as root

Running osbash as root or using sudo is not necessary and can lead to
unexpected behavior (e.g., "invisible" VMs owned by root rather than
the user).

With this patch, osbash complains and aborts if it run as root.

Change-Id: I08367980a78012e1aed21fde7ca7fb6408fd5933
Partial-Bug: #1602272

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-23 11:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Fixes port device_id/device_owner change in failed operation

If a router is a attached to a neutron port and that operation
fails at a late stage in the processing then the 'device_id' and
'device_owner' attributes of the port are still changed. The
failed operation should not change them.

The reason is, as of commit 0947458018725b241603139f4ec6f92e84b2f29b,
the update of those attributes happens outside of the DB transaction.
For failed operation, the values are not reset back to their original
values.

Change-Id: I797df266dafc41843408dc95a6ce9f986db5c21c
Closes-Bug: #1523859
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes port device_id/device_owner change in failed operation

If a router is a attached to a neutron port and that operation
fails at a late stage in the processing then the 'device_id' and
'device_owner' attributes of the port are still changed. The
failed operation should not change them.

The reason is, as of commit 0947458018725b241603139f4ec6f92e84b2f29b,
the update of those attributes happens outside of the DB transaction.
For failed operation, the values are not reset back to their original
values.

Change-Id: I797df266dafc41843408dc95a6ce9f986db5c21c
Closes-Bug: #1523859

commit_message:
Allow configuration of multiple rabbit clusters

Introduced new variables so the transport_url values
used for RPC and notifications can vary. By default
they will remain the same.

Change-Id: I96acacedd20c4556d1132228a797da5c0d0c754c
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Install python-bson for Ceilometer for ubuntu

When running Ceilometer bootstrap container task, it fails with
ceilometer-dbsync error:

ImportError: No module named bson.code

Fixes this by installing python-bson explicitly.

Change-Id: I350b8ea6033ca60d6ff3134b22b0ecf6669b556c
Closes-bug: #1605531

subject: Cache fragment size for EC policy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-22 16:45:27.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py'], 'message': "Cache fragment size for EC policy

ECStoragePolicy.fragment_size is never changed on running Swift because
it is from ec_segment_size and ec_type defined in swift.conf statically
so let's cache the value after retrieving the value from the pyeclib driver.

And more, pyeclib <= 1.2.1 (current newest) has a bug [1] to leak the reference
count of the items in the returned dict (i.e. causes memory leak) so that
this caching will be mitigation of the memory leak because this saves the call
count fewer than current as possible.

Note that the complete fix for the memory leak for pyeclib is proposed at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344066/

1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/pyeclib/+bug/1604335

Related-Bug: #1604335
Change-Id: I6bbaa4063dc462383c949764b6567b2bee233689
"}]
commit_message:
Cache fragment size for EC policy

ECStoragePolicy.fragment_size is never changed on running Swift because
it is from ec_segment_size and ec_type defined in swift.conf statically
so let's cache the value after retrieving the value from the pyeclib driver.

And more, pyeclib <= 1.2.1 (current newest) has a bug [1] to leak the reference
count of the items in the returned dict (i.e. causes memory leak) so that
this caching will be mitigation of the memory leak because this saves the call
count fewer than current as possible.

Note that the complete fix for the memory leak for pyeclib is proposed at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344066/

1: https://bugs.launchpad.net/pyeclib/+bug/1604335

Related-Bug: #1604335
Change-Id: I6bbaa4063dc462383c949764b6567b2bee233689

commit_message:
[Tempest] Create heavy scenario resources in parallel

Manila Tempest scenario tests create all resources one by one and they
are very slow because of it.
Therefore, make all resource 'waiters' run after all resource creation
requests are sent.

Change-Id: I435a5d04bce340b0a2c0a2d30fa5a99e50b311e1
Closes-Bug: #1493405

commit_message:
Invalid volume state when manage operation fails

If an exception is thrown during the manage operation the Cinder volume
that is created is left in "creating" state. Previously the volume state
was set to "error".

Closes-Bug: #1603549
Change-Id: I04f522f2bf6eecb51daece53657533672d5fec2d

subject: Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-22 21:46:54.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/identity/v2_0/role.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1605774-28aec51f6ec4926e.yaml', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/role.py', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v3/test_role_assignment.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v2_0/role_assignment.py', 'openstackclient/identity/v3/role_assignment.py', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v2_0/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/identity/v2_0/test_role_assignment.py', 'doc/source/command-objects/role-assignment.rst', 'setup.cfg', 'doc/source/command-objects/role.rst'], 'message': "Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing

The current identity role list command (both v2 and v3) is
overloaded with listing roles as well as assignments (if you
provide user, group, project or domain options). This is in
addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious (this is in a follow on patch).

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignments list, with support for pulling the
user and project from the auth credentials
- For comapability, adds the same auth support to the
existing v3 assignments list
- Deprecates the use of role list and user role list to list
assignments

Change-Id: I65bafdef4f8c89e863dab101369d0d629fa818b8
Partial-Bug: 1605774
"}]
commit_message:
Add assignment list to v2 identity and deprecate alternate listing

The current identity role list command (both v2 and v3) is
overloaded with listing roles as well as assignments (if you
provide user, group, project or domain options). This is in
addition to the v3 assignment list command designed for this
purpose.

This overloading complicates the fact that roles can now be
domain specific (i.e. have a domain attribute), so the
command 'role list --domain <domain-name' will soon become
ambigious (this is in a follow on patch).

This patch:

- Adds a v2 assignments list, with support for pulling the
user and project from the auth credentials
- For comapability, adds the same auth support to the
existing v3 assignments list
- Deprecates the use of role list and user role list to list
assignments

Change-Id: I65bafdef4f8c89e863dab101369d0d629fa818b8
Partial-Bug: 1605774

revisions:
[{'number': 63, 'created': '2016-07-14 15:10:42.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/security_compliance.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_validation.py', 'keystone/identity/core.py', 'keystone/common/validation/validators.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py', 'keystone/exception.py'], 'message': 'PCI-DSS Password strength requirements

This patch implements PCI-DSS password strength requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.3: Passwords/phrases must meet the following: 1) Require a
minimum length of at least seven characters. 2) Contain both numeric and
alphabetic characters. Alternatively, the passwords/phrases must have
complexity and strength at least equivalent to the parameters specified
above.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: I32ef8deb0a7c48511229f95f7cc973ab0d183372
'}]
commit_message:
PCI-DSS Password strength requirements

This patch implements PCI-DSS password strength requirements:

* PCI-DSS 8.2.3: Passwords/phrases must meet the following: 1) Require a
minimum length of at least seven characters. 2) Contain both numeric and
alphabetic characters. Alternatively, the passwords/phrases must have
complexity and strength at least equivalent to the parameters specified
above.

Partially-implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: I32ef8deb0a7c48511229f95f7cc973ab0d183372

commit_message:
Make environment-action-call command accept JSON arguments

Actions can accept different data types as arguments (strings,
numbers, dicts, lists). Previously only strings could be passed
to action through command line. Now CLI accepts arguments in
JSON format additionally to the simple old format.

Change-Id: Ic71d825fca4d9791055b4f82c6574d385e23f8ff
Closes-bug: #1604852

commit_message:
Remove the mask password logic in vim list and vim show

In vim list and vim show command,
since hashed password masking on server-side,
the "mask_dict_password" modules are removed on client-side.

Change-Id: I463cb04696dc09157fbbc4b0bd64e66850feac84
Depends-On: Ice5c51b6a66cd27f21c144d3a672cf790e4cec41
Closes-bug: #1594495

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 13438, 'name': 'Kobi Samoray', 'email': 'ksamoray@vmware.com', 'username': 'ksamoray'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 09:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['etc/dhcp/dhclient.conf'], 'message': 'Disbale DNS update for port o-hm0 in devstack

Disable the DNS update for port o-hm0 during the installation of
devstack to aviod accidentally DNS change.

Note: NetworkManager will attempt to write DNS information from
DHCP into /etc/resolv.conf, overwriting the existing contents.
So, if you have NetworkManager enabled, the once for all solution
should be set the immutable bit on the file:
    chattr +i /etc/resolv.conf

Change-Id: Icbc23feb8cb3c9967aa66a3c6c2f61da61397d11
'}]
commit_message:
Disbale DNS update for port o-hm0 in devstack

Disable the DNS update for port o-hm0 during the installation of
devstack to aviod accidentally DNS change.

Note: NetworkManager will attempt to write DNS information from
DHCP into /etc/resolv.conf, overwriting the existing contents.
So, if you have NetworkManager enabled, the once for all solution
should be set the immutable bit on the file:
    chattr +i /etc/resolv.conf

Change-Id: Icbc23feb8cb3c9967aa66a3c6c2f61da61397d11

unavailable.

Added thin_provisioning_support = True to the volume stats since
the Dell driver only supports thin provisioning.

Change-Id: I1b2875aa275a72b4f434d8c3d20c82b176ec4dc0

commit_message:
Dell SC: Add secondary DSM support

Adds support for a secondary DSM in case the primary becomes
unavailable.

Added thin_provisioning_support = True to the volume stats since
the Dell driver only supports thin provisioning.

Change-Id: I1b2875aa275a72b4f434d8c3d20c82b176ec4dc0

commit_message:
Provide default for rabbitmq telemetry password

In order to maintain current behavior when deploying ceilometer using
the integrated release, default 'cinder_rabbitmq_telemetry_password'
to 'cinder_rabbitmq_password'. 'cinder_rabbitmq_telemetry_*' vars
may be provided by the user as overrides if a separate rabbitmq cluster
is being used for telemetry.

Also update the configured transport_urls to only include a comma
between urls and re-add rabbit configuration information to the
oslo_messaging_rabbit block.

Change-Id: Ie08ee95eb16120c8747f32cd8d27325fe8bef0d5

commit_message:
Cleanup the toastService in *.spec.js files

We should not use toastService to test if an API call
went through successfully. This is extraneous.

This patch was motivated by the fact that we want to
remove conf.js, so we are moving the toast config
options to toast.service.js.

Change-Id: I966fb0d492ae8e9ae70af2882655cd36b4214a4a

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-07 15:32:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Allow auto-addressed ips deletion on port update

By default ips for auto-addressed subnets can not be removed from port
using port_update workflow. But during subnet_delete it has to be done
via update_port to make sure that ipam drivers received appropriate call
to deallocate ip addresses prior to subnet deletion.

'fixed_ips' property is tweeked to allow deletion ips from
auto-addressed subnet. 'delete_subnet' boolean is added to mark subnet
that is going to be deleted. This flag is analysed in
_get_changed_ips_for_port to skip re-adding slaac subnets for the port.

Closes-Bug: #1564335
Change-Id: Iec171efe8b64f8a6dc6cb003b97c11667c5e0048

commit_message:
Allow auto-addressed ips deletion on port update

By default ips for auto-addressed subnets can not be removed from port
using port_update workflow. But during subnet_delete it has to be done
via update_port to make sure that ipam drivers received appropriate call
to deallocate ip addresses prior to subnet deletion.

'fixed_ips' property is tweeked to allow deletion ips from
auto-addressed subnet. 'delete_subnet' boolean is added to mark subnet
that is going to be deleted. This flag is analysed in
_get_changed_ips_for_port to skip re-adding slaac subnets for the port.

Closes-Bug: #1564335
Change-Id: Iec171efe8b64f8a6dc6cb003b97c11667c5e0048

commit_message:
Provide default for rabbitmq telemetry password

In order to maintain current behavior when deploying ceilometer using
the integrated release, default 'glance_rabbitmq_telemetry_password'
to 'glance_rabbitmq_password'. 'glance_rabbitmq_telemetry_*' vars
may be provided by the user as overrides if a separate rabbitmq cluster
is being used for telemetry.

Also update the configured transport_urls to only include a comma
between urls and re-add rabbit configuration information to the
oslo_messaging_rabbit block.

Change-Id: I74fcd572acd029ae991fea8d00f8bb4e0251ccc8

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/services/trunk/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py'], 'message': "Revisit (add|remove)_subports request body

The neutronclient [1] expects to serialize a dictionary any
time there is a body in the request. The (add|remove)_subports
methods were expecting a list of dicts instead.

This patch rectifies the issue by assuming a dict in the
body of the format {'sub_ports': [<my-subports]}. This is
indeed the most conventional way to pass request data to
Neutron server, and it was overlooked during a past review.

This was discovered during development of the client side
patch [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/blob/master/neutronclient/v2_0/client.py#L292
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340624/

Change-Id: I8d36c61dd877d0ccb73c18702ed64897b71f001b
"}]
commit_message:
Revisit (add|remove)_subports request body

The neutronclient [1] expects to serialize a dictionary any
time there is a body in the request. The (add|remove)_subports
methods were expecting a list of dicts instead.

This patch rectifies the issue by assuming a dict in the
body of the format {'sub_ports': [<my-subports]}. This is
indeed the most conventional way to pass request data to
Neutron server, and it was overlooked during a past review.

This was discovered during development of the client side
patch [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/blob/master/neutronclient/v2_0/client.py#L292
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340624/

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: I8d36c61dd877d0ccb73c18702ed64897b71f001b

commit_message:
Improve the segmentation ID validation logic

Segmentation ID is meant to be an Integer as per model,
and as such it is best to attempt a conversion in case
it happens to be sent as string as done in [1]. The
failure mode in this case is not immediately obvious
as the ID range check fails and yet the ID is indeed
in range.

This patch also dedups some logic, clean up and add a
test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340624/7/neutronclient/osc/v2/trunk/subport.py@36

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms

Change-Id: I7ca4c93fdf0ab83088194e9a343448ed511d4cdb

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (specifically, before Mitaka, all networks
were getting MTU = 0 by default, disabling both advertisement and data
path MTU size enforcement).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

DocImpact Now changes to MTU configuration options immediately affect
          existing network MTUs, not just new networks.

UpgradeImpact Existing networks with invalid MTU persisted in database
              may change their MTU values to reflect configuration.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182
'}]
commit_message:
Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (specifically, before Mitaka, all networks
were getting MTU = 0 by default, disabling both advertisement and data
path MTU size enforcement).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

DocImpact Now changes to MTU configuration options immediately affect
          existing network MTUs, not just new networks.

UpgradeImpact Existing networks with invalid MTU persisted in database
              may change their MTU values to reflect configuration.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182

commit_message:
objects: better apply filters for objects/db/api/get_object query.

Problem found when querying for shared subnet. Current implementation for
filtering is applying the filter_by(id=xxx) to NetworkRBAC id, not the
subnets.id field.

Change-Id: I9343ccbbb9723582db4365d671505d0bb6eba72d
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
objects: Add RBAC to Subnet OVO

Subnet 'shared' attribute is dependent from network 'shared' state.
Added helper methods in rbac_db to calculate the share state based on
rbac_entries.
Refactor existing RbacNeutronDbObjectMixin is_shared_with_tenant method
to be able to use it within already opened session.

Change-Id: I235cf3d37fefa27c005cff992a08fd324e910e75
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:43:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/subnet.py', 'neutron/objects/port/extensions/allowedaddresspairs.py', 'neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py', 'neutron/objects/subnetpool.py'], 'message': "objects: Convert filters to string for list values.

When request from API is passed to get_objects, filters are converted
by modify_fields_to_db. API is passing the arguments with format:
filters = {'key': ['val']}
In some classes (like Subnet, Subnetpool, AllowedAddessPairs) value of
filters has to be converted from IPNetwork, IPAddress and MACAddress
to string value format.

Current implementation in modify_fields_to_db did not take under
consideration that value passed in fields dict can be a list of
CIDRs, IPs or MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I70230a40973f5e7c3d0e325de658830eba036813
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
"}]
commit_message:
objects: Convert filters to string for list values.

When request from API is passed to get_objects, filters are converted
by modify_fields_to_db. API is passing the arguments with format:
filters = {'key': ['val']}
In some classes (like Subnet, Subnetpool, AllowedAddessPairs) value of
filters has to be converted from IPNetwork, IPAddress and MACAddress
to string value format.

Current implementation in modify_fields_to_db did not take under
consideration that value passed in fields dict can be a list of
CIDRs, IPs or MAC addresses.

Change-Id: I70230a40973f5e7c3d0e325de658830eba036813
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Add function to return all hosts with mapped segments

In the agentless topology, for example ovn, hosts might be removed from
the topology, during neutron service down. When neutron service up, a
full sync will be performed. But only existing hosts will be synced.
There is no way to know which hosts are removed, and there are stale
SegmentHostMapping left behind.

This patch adds a function to return all hosts with mapped segments, so
that it is possible to compare existing hosts with all hosts in DB. And
delete stale records if there is any. It is applied at [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/337685

Change-Id: I53863c9983e933872fb0adbc964e5a88d0238bf2
Partially-implements: blueprint routed-networks

available when iterating plugins.

subject: Add prompt parameter to Opt
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 00:21:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/loading/opts.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-prompt-to-opt-d083acc357a7f07b.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v2.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/v3.py', 'keystoneauth1/loading/_plugins/identity/generic.py'], 'message': 'Add prompt parameter to Opt

The prompt parameter is supposed to provide both an indication to
loaders that it is ok to prompt the user for input for an option and
also an appropriate message that can be used.

It would be up to the loader whether it wanted to use that message or
something it generated.

This will allow os-client-config and openstackclient better control over
the loading of sensitive authentication options.

Related-Bug: #1519202
Change-Id: I7c39f25b78404950af6f6eaf21739be1c1ef9c6a

commit_message:
Add prompt parameter to Opt

The prompt parameter is supposed to provide both an indication to
loaders that it is ok to prompt the user for input for an option and
also an appropriate message that can be used.

It would be up to the loader whether it wanted to use that message or
something it generated.

This will allow os-client-config and openstackclient better control over
the loading of sensitive authentication options.

Related-Bug: #1519202
Change-Id: I7c39f25b78404950af6f6eaf21739be1c1ef9c6a

subject: Fix provider network setup
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-22 19:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-compute.sh', 'vagrant/provisioning/setup-controller.sh', 'devstack/lib/networking-ovn', 'vagrant/provisioning/provider-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Fix provider network setup

A recent DevStack change [1] broke the networking-ovn gate. The
change is being reverted [2] to unbreak the gate. However, the
change found a weakness in the OVN provider network setup. In
particular when Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC=True, the
networking-ovn DevStack plugin should setup the bridge and
bridge mapping like it does when Q_USE_PROVIDER_NETWORKING=True.

The vagrant deployment broke in a different way because
PHYSICAL_NETWORK was not set (which is used to set the
flat networks supported). To fix this, the vagrant deployment
will now use the networking-ovn DevStack plugin for basic
provider network setup.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/343072/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345820/

Related-Bug: #1605423
Change-Id: I63dd83b2374071703d341ec9e8d4d28c11174683
'}]
commit_message:
Fix provider network setup

A recent DevStack change [1] broke the networking-ovn gate. The
change is being reverted [2] to unbreak the gate. However, the
change found a weakness in the OVN provider network setup. In
particular when Q_USE_PROVIDERNET_FOR_PUBLIC=True, the
networking-ovn DevStack plugin should setup the bridge and
bridge mapping like it does when Q_USE_PROVIDER_NETWORKING=True.

The vagrant deployment broke in a different way because
PHYSICAL_NETWORK was not set (which is used to set the
flat networks supported). To fix this, the vagrant deployment
will now use the networking-ovn DevStack plugin for basic
provider network setup.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/343072/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345820/

Related-Bug: #1605423
Change-Id: I63dd83b2374071703d341ec9e8d4d28c11174683

commit_message:
objects: introduce NetworkPortSecurity object

Since there are two models for binding, and it's easier if they behave
identically from objects POV, renamed port_id field in PortSecurity into
id, and kept the same fields in NetworkPortSecurity.

Switched db code to using those objects. Some refactoring took place to
reduce code duplication.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: Ic104f113c4aa3f0c1448f83fe5128feed7b4444b

commit_message:
Add missing db sync includes

When you re-run openstack undercloud install and it pulls in some new
version of a service, the DB sync has to be done manually or the
services are broken.  This aims to fix that by explicitly including
the various db::sync manifests.  I'm not quite sure why these aren't
needed for initial deployment atm.

Change-Id: I773975669abe23f5b78b9ccbb70678cc577968a8
Closes-Bug: #1604345

subject: Standardise tempest role
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-22 21:41:38.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'tasks/tempest_post_install.yml', 'tasks/tempest_install.yml', 'templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Standardise tempest role

All of our roles have a standard pattern for installing services,
however tempest does things slightly differently.  I think most of this
is legacy and this commit brings tempest in line (for the most part)
with how other roles are written.

Note that tempest now has a ``tempest`` cli, and in a future commit we
will update this role to use that instead.  This will allow us to skip
the additional step of cloning the tempest git repo to act as a working
directory when running tests.

For some background as to why this work is being done, newer versions
of tempest are failing when run in an IRR because we are not installing
urllib3 into tempest's venv.  This is not an issue when we do an
integrated build because the repo server actually installs tempest into
the tempest venv, and all requirements get satisfied.  However, when we
install tempest without a repo server we simply install
tempest_pip_packages (which previously did not include tempest itself)
into the tempest venv.  We could update update tempest_pip_packages to
include urllib3, but doing so creates duplicate work as this
requirement is already captured in tempest's requirements.txt.

Conflicts:
	defaults/main.yml
	tasks/tempest_install.yml
	tests/test-vars.yml

Change-Id: I6f3c36a8150b83afabae8d397d5fc7340dbc93fd
(cherry picked from commit 75bd092b9e66e4ef79bfc4449ec60901496128d4)
"}]
commit_message:
Standardise tempest role

All of our roles have a standard pattern for installing services,
however tempest does things slightly differently.  I think most of this
is legacy and this commit brings tempest in line (for the most part)
with how other roles are written.

Note that tempest now has a ``tempest`` cli, and in a future commit we
will update this role to use that instead.  This will allow us to skip
the additional step of cloning the tempest git repo to act as a working
directory when running tests.

For some background as to why this work is being done, newer versions
of tempest are failing when run in an IRR because we are not installing
urllib3 into tempest's venv.  This is not an issue when we do an
integrated build because the repo server actually installs tempest into
the tempest venv, and all requirements get satisfied.  However, when we
install tempest without a repo server we simply install
tempest_pip_packages (which previously did not include tempest itself)
into the tempest venv.  We could update update tempest_pip_packages to
include urllib3, but doing so creates duplicate work as this
requirement is already captured in tempest's requirements.txt.

Conflicts:
	defaults/main.yml
	tasks/tempest_install.yml
	tests/test-vars.yml

Change-Id: I6f3c36a8150b83afabae8d397d5fc7340dbc93fd
(cherry picked from commit 75bd092b9e66e4ef79bfc4449ec60901496128d4)

subject: Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-18 13:24:19.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml', 'templates/ceilometer.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

The ceilometer role is now significantly more configurable
with respect to RabbitMQ cluster configuration. The following
changes have been made:

 * Host group for the ceilometer RabbitMQ cluster is now configurable
   via ceilometer_rabbitmq_host_group. This breaks the strict dependency
   on the rabbitmq_all inventory group

 * All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
   was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

 * Notification agent rabbitmq config now supports service-specific
   clusters for services: glance, nova, neutron, cinder, keystone and heat

Change-Id: I38bfba8d134e152f33df187851d6dd6c250cdd60
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters
'}]
commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

The ceilometer role is now significantly more configurable
with respect to RabbitMQ cluster configuration. The following
changes have been made:

 * Host group for the ceilometer RabbitMQ cluster is now configurable
   via ceilometer_rabbitmq_host_group. This breaks the strict dependency
   on the rabbitmq_all inventory group

 * All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
   was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

 * Notification agent rabbitmq config now supports service-specific
   clusters for services: glance, nova, neutron, cinder, keystone and heat

Change-Id: I38bfba8d134e152f33df187851d6dd6c250cdd60
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274425 ) merged before the
one to fix the PXC secure routine, so the newly added
urllib.quote code was missed.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320697

commit_message:
Add missing py34 support for urllib

The changeset to port url methods to py34 (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/274425 ) merged before the
one to fix the PXC secure routine, so the newly added
urllib.quote code was missed.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320697

This change bring the url quoting in mysql_common/service.py up to
py34 standards.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

commit_message:
OSprofiler initialization method

Added init_from_conf method, that takes service configuration
and initializes notifier. This allows initialization to be
handled in osprofiler instead of projects/services. Added
oslo.messaging dependency.

Change-Id: I77d0d3b5e9e725507916724dcd28d5fbc6f7f5c7

subject: Vagrant: Don't duplicate networking-ovn directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 20:08:47.000000000', 'files': ['vagrant/provisioning/setup-base.sh'], 'message': "Vagrant: Don't duplicate networking-ovn directory

Vagrantfile will create a sync folder at /home/vagrant/networking-ovn
to facilitate testing networking-ovn changes stored on the host.
However, DevStack will generate its own clone of networking-ovn under
/opt/stack. As a result, only vagrant networking-ovn changes stored
on the host will be tested.

This patch set fixes the problem by creating a symbolic link from
/opt/stack/networking-ovn to /home/vagrant/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I7f7c73bdaf9b0147af0638b055762dc9f965dba3
"}]
commit_message:
Vagrant: Don't duplicate networking-ovn directory

Vagrantfile will create a sync folder at /home/vagrant/networking-ovn
to facilitate testing networking-ovn changes stored on the host.
However, DevStack will generate its own clone of networking-ovn under
/opt/stack. As a result, only vagrant networking-ovn changes stored
on the host will be tested.

This patch set fixes the problem by creating a symbolic link from
/opt/stack/networking-ovn to /home/vagrant/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I7f7c73bdaf9b0147af0638b055762dc9f965dba3

commit_message:
Huawei: Check when attach hypermetro volume

Currently when we attach a hypermetro volume,
if the map info is none there is not logged
that is due to the array version does not
support hypermetro.

Change-Id: I51dc3e5b21fb0d44b00e498c4b2144e57b07e73c
Closes-Bug: #1549130

subject: "server list": "Image Name", "Image ID" columns
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-06 14:11:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': '"server list": "Image Name", "Image ID" columns

The `Image Name` column is shown by default (i.e.: without passing `--long`). E.g.:

```
$ openstack server list
WARNING: openstackclient.common.utils is deprecated and will be removed after Jun 2017. Please use osc_lib.utils
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+---------+----------------------+----------------------+
| ID                                   | Name            | Status  | Networks             | Image Name           |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+---------+----------------------+----------------------+
| abe67035-b14f-4541-b436-e0e778ec4227 | n9anonw302mgm1  | ACTIVE  | mnky3-3000=10.3.0.55 | Koala.2016-07-01-175 |
| 8f6a2d12-2bc3-4d89-ba94-8916ce9cdf92 | n9anonw301mgm1  | ACTIVE  | mnky3-3000=10.3.0.37 | Koala.2016-07-01-175 |
| b316d6d1-67cf-4f75-94a4-4c9a2b03f6a4 | n9dobby301mgm0  | ACTIVE  | mnky3-3000=10.3.0.36 | Koala.2016-05-04-130 |
+--------------------------------------+-----------------+---------+----------------------+----------------------+
```

The `Image ID` column is only available with `--long`. E.g.:

```
$ openstack server list --long -c Name -c "Image Name" -c "Image ID"
WARNING: openstackclient.common.utils is deprecated and will be removed after Jun 2017. Please use osc_lib.utils
+-----------------+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Name            | Image Name           | Image ID                             |
+-----------------+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| n9anonw302mgm1  | Koala.2016-07-01-175 | f587c6fc-1df3-42cd-ac86-8cd2c995a8d9 |
| n9anonw301mgm1  | Koala.2016-07-01-175 | f587c6fc-1df3-42cd-ac86-8cd2c995a8d9 |
| n9dobby301mgm0  | Koala.2016-05-04-130 | 37ff47a6-3e51-4986-bfa5-62afbfad5dfc |
+-----------------+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
```

Closes-Bug: #1599304

Change-Id: I477995b840eb9520b285948926ebbfe1777dd86c
'}]

subject: Flush puppet output piped to awk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 12:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/os-refresh-config/configure.d/50-puppet-stack-config'], 'message': 'Flush puppet output piped to awk

Calling fflush() in the awk command to add timestamps to the puppet
output makes the output appear more quickly when watching the undercloud
install.  Otherwise, the output is being buffered by awk, and is only
updated every so often.

Change-Id: I3d4bf48812f28a2da75d7ad979f49c8e76a76ea7
'}]
commit_message:
Flush puppet output piped to awk

Calling fflush() in the awk command to add timestamps to the puppet
output makes the output appear more quickly when watching the undercloud
install.  Otherwise, the output is being buffered by awk, and is only
updated every so often.

Change-Id: I3d4bf48812f28a2da75d7ad979f49c8e76a76ea7

commit_message:
Display ES indices

To allow admins to better control their
Elasticsearch usage, we want to display all
aliases that are currently being used by
Searchlight. This will allow the observant admin
to detect any orphaned indices within
Elasticsearch and deal with them appropriately.

Change-Id: I990f442ea079985615306917bc8a1d59900bbd20
Implements: blueprint Orphaned ES Aliases

commit_message:
Adds support for  notification plugins in monacaapi

This review
  1) Removes the hard coded notification types
  2) Adds a new Rest API to get the notification types

Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin
Change-Id: I322d1277c1859c990e150f22eceff122ffd77cea

commit_message:
v2: Add headers for image-create

Refactoring the image import requires the image-create method to return more
headers. This patch adds the OpenStack-image-import-methods and
OpenStack-image-glance-direct-url headers.

Change-Id: I310193283a1a5e8206feda6cbf46cf39e49d6260
Partially-blueprint: image-import-refactor
Partial-Bug: #1523941

commit_message:
Scubber: if run as non-daemon re-raise exception

If the scrubber runs not in daemon mode exit in error
case and re-raise the exception.

Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 22:09:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'WIP DHCP agents should not set default route to a subnet on another segment

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment has its
own default gateway.  The DHCP was just setting the default gateway to
whatever the first DHCP enabled subnet with a gateway was.  But, that
one might not be on the right segment.

This is a work-around which just catches the RuntimeError and skips
that subnet.  We should discuss how to do this correctly.

Change-Id: I13d790226d4c640f3e5795fe59c771b4069f6a55
'}]
commit_message:
WIP DHCP agents should not set default route to a subnet on another segment

Since a network can now be broken up by segments, each segment has its
own default gateway.  The DHCP was just setting the default gateway to
whatever the first DHCP enabled subnet with a gateway was.  But, that
one might not be on the right segment.

This is a work-around which just catches the RuntimeError and skips
that subnet.  We should discuss how to do this correctly.

Change-Id: I13d790226d4c640f3e5795fe59c771b4069f6a55

commit_message:
'image-show' does not show attributes whose value is 'None'

It will be removed whose value is 'None' in function meta of class
ImageSerializer,user will not know these attributes in this case.
So remove the filter for value with 'None'.

Change-Id: I91e2c8bf8c87c670ebf18eb073160ed7e9b9e8aa
Closes-Bug: #1551225

commit_message:
raise changed to "save_and_reraise_exception"

excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() should be used instead of
re-raise as in some cases the exception context can be cleared,
resulting in None being attempted to be re-raised after an exception
handler is run (see excutils.save_and_reraise_exception for more).

Closes-Bug:#1281453
Change-Id: I2770ff3acbe8ea8bfa287cd17020040d55c216b7

commit_message:
Bump the API version to 2.4

The work on the image import process requires the API version to be
bumped to indicate the addition of this new feature and everything
related to it.

This patch kicks of the work related to this spec.

MitakaPriority
Closes-bug: #1523934
Partially-Implements blueprint: image-import-refactor

Change-Id: I5c7f485f97719af876fcc89ac16522d81824efc1

commit_message:
Deprecate config options for image locations

In the current implementation the following options define if
image location should be available in image-show output:
show_multiple_locations and show_image_direct_url.
This functionality is already covered by policy.json
so we don't need to repeat the code and choose only one
approach: use policy.json to manage an access to image locations.

Change-Id: Ic0983baae7f63982aa0f57be561b54a0fc17e442
Closes-Bug: #1535437

Extend attempting to use a version for keystone if it is not in the
url. Currently it only raises in the case that
exception.AuthorizationFailure is returned. This will also do in in the
case that exception.AuthUrlNotFound is returned, possibly causing a
correct url and going through.

This also adds some logging lines to make it easier to debug in the
future.

Currently the prefetcher only works for public images (images that the

Change-Id: I1ff7175feade22150d33f106c6f6e93fd59fa8e6
Closes-Bug: 1540934

commit_message:
Fix glance-cache-prefetcher

Extend attempting to use a version for keystone if it is not in the
url. Currently it only raises in the case that
exception.AuthorizationFailure is returned. This will also do in in the
case that exception.AuthUrlNotFound is returned, possibly causing a
correct url and going through.

This also adds some logging lines to make it easier to debug in the
future.

Currently the prefetcher only works for public images (images that the
user 'glance' has access to in the registry).

Change-Id: I1ff7175feade22150d33f106c6f6e93fd59fa8e6
Closes-Bug: 1540934

subject: Update all SHAs for 12.1.1
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-07-22 16:29:37.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml', 'requirements.txt', 'global-requirement-pins.txt', 'scripts/sources-branch-updater.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Update all SHAs for 12.1.1

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/liberty.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies.

Change-Id: Ic8a2d8d34418f71d55d3e359599a1b449b70a94f
Depends-On: I5be589bc34ab4f0478c76733ebf380e975071564
"}]
commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 12.1.1

This patch includes updates of any changed paste, policy and rootwrap
configurations. It also includes updates to the pip, wheel and
setuptools pins. Finally, it also updates the required roles and
copies any release notes from those roles.

It also includes the following:

- The requirements.txt file has been updated to ensure that it
  has the same requirements as those in OpenStack global-requirements
  for stable/liberty.

- The sources-branch-updater script will only update SHA's/tags
  for OpenStack roles. This is primarily for usage in stable
  branches where external roles must not be changed after release.

- The script will no longer update the *requirements.txt files.
  These files are managed by the OpenStack Global Requirements
  management process.

- The pins for pip, setuptools and wheels are now set in the
  global-requirement-pins.txt file in order to ensure that it
  takes precedence in the repo build process above all other
  requirements.

- The order of the requirements.txt file has been changed to ensure
  that pip, setuptools and wheels is installed first whenever the
  requirements.txt file is used.

- The pin comment has been removed from the requirements.txt file
  as it no longer applies.

Change-Id: Ic8a2d8d34418f71d55d3e359599a1b449b70a94f
Depends-On: I5be589bc34ab4f0478c76733ebf380e975071564

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded monasca notification types

This patch enables adding custom notificatin types. Notification
types are moved from ENUM in code to configuration entries. This
enables us to write new notification types without touching the code
in monasca-api

Change-Id: I54302651bd57555a44c8254fe820c0ef64abfa31
Partially-implements: blueprint notification-engine-plugin

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 20:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'DO NOT MERGE: Run tempest serially

In order to get a better handle on the performance of individual tempest
tests run tempest with a concurrency of 1. This will reduce the amount
of noise tests generate against each other by running at the same time
and give us fairly accurate individual test runtime numbers.

Change-Id: I7958d61d9d3772fb4d083015d8b296bfa9774074
'}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Run tempest serially

In order to get a better handle on the performance of individual tempest
tests run tempest with a concurrency of 1. This will reduce the amount
of noise tests generate against each other by running at the same time
and give us fairly accurate individual test runtime numbers.

Change-Id: I7958d61d9d3772fb4d083015d8b296bfa9774074

commit_message:
glance-replicator: size: Handle no args better

Check if `args is None` before doing `len(args)` to avoid `object of type
'NoneType'` has no len()` error.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-20 21:19:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/utils.py', 'congress/api/table_model.py', 'congress/dse2/data_service.py', 'congress/api/base.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py', 'congress/dse2/dse_node.py', 'congress/api/rule_model.py', 'congress/api/datasource_model.py', 'congress/managers/datasource.py', 'congress/api/action_model.py', 'congress/api/status_model.py', 'congress/api/policy_model.py', 'congress/api/api_utils.py', 'congress/api/row_model.py', 'congress/api/schema_model.py', 'congress/dse2/control_bus.py'], 'message': 'Thread-safety review

Manually reviewed source code to identify:
- blocking functions [Note(thread-safety): blocking function]
- blocking calls [Note(thread-safety): blocking call]
- potential thread safety issues [FIXME(thread-safety)]

In summary, there are only two main kinds thread safety issues
identified:
1. Every time the API model converts a UUID to a name via the DB,
   but because the call is a blocking call, the executing greenthread
   may yield control. But the time the greenthread resumes, the name
   obtained from the DB may not refer to the item identified by the
   original UUID any more.
   If the original request was done by name (converted to UUID for
   API), then the behavior might be acceptable. If user says
   "delete nova", but by the time the request is processed nove
   refers to something else, tough luck. But the behavior is not
   acceptable, however, if the original user request was by UUID.
2. Similar to the issue of the synchronizer interrupting a,
   datasource creation, there is an analogous issue with
   datasource deletion.

Reviewed files:
- congress/api/*
- congress/dse2/*
- congress/policy_engine/agnostic.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py
- congress/managers/datasource.py
- congress/utils.py

Note: I do not expect this analysis to be complete.

Change-Id: Ic9f85293b91de1734e2682fda755276fe08dc903
'}]
commit_message:
Thread-safety review

Manually reviewed source code to identify:
- blocking functions [Note(thread-safety): blocking function]
- blocking calls [Note(thread-safety): blocking call]
- potential thread safety issues [FIXME(thread-safety)]

In summary, there are only two main kinds thread safety issues
identified:
1. Every time the API model converts a UUID to a name via the DB,
   but because the call is a blocking call, the executing greenthread
   may yield control. But the time the greenthread resumes, the name
   obtained from the DB may not refer to the item identified by the
   original UUID any more.
   If the original request was done by name (converted to UUID for
   API), then the behavior might be acceptable. If user says
   "delete nova", but by the time the request is processed nove
   refers to something else, tough luck. But the behavior is not
   acceptable, however, if the original user request was by UUID.
2. Similar to the issue of the synchronizer interrupting a,
   datasource creation, there is an analogous issue with
   datasource deletion.

Reviewed files:
- congress/api/*
- congress/dse2/*
- congress/policy_engine/agnostic.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py
- congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py
- congress/managers/datasource.py
- congress/utils.py

Note: I do not expect this analysis to be complete.

Change-Id: Ic9f85293b91de1734e2682fda755276fe08dc903

subject: apt-get needs access to tty so give it access
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1106, 'name': 'Ricardo Carrillo Cruz', 'email': 'ricardo.carrillo.cruz@gmail.com', 'username': 'rcc'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-02 20:08:56.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "apt-get needs access to tty so give it access

When we run stack.sh it runs apt-get which hangs on SIGTTIN if we don't
give it access to its TTY. Timeout by default removes access if you
don't pass in the --foreground option which leads to hung devstack runs.

Run timeout with --foreground to avoid this problem. Note that child
processes are not killed when you use the --foreground option with
timeout, but this should be ok as the timeout should cause any jobs to
fail, children processes will get reparented to init and reaped.

Change-Id: I6f5eedf7d04cd4486fbc5d3251029f331d12d510
"}]
commit_message:
apt-get needs access to tty so give it access

When we run stack.sh it runs apt-get which hangs on SIGTTIN if we don't
give it access to its TTY. Timeout by default removes access if you
don't pass in the --foreground option which leads to hung devstack runs.

Run timeout with --foreground to avoid this problem. Note that child
processes are not killed when you use the --foreground option with
timeout, but this should be ok as the timeout should cause any jobs to
fail, children processes will get reparented to init and reaped.

Change-Id: I6f5eedf7d04cd4486fbc5d3251029f331d12d510

commit_message:
Add DriverFilter and GoodnessWeigher to manila

This patch ports cinder's DriverFilter and GoodnessWeigher to manila.
These can use two new properties provided by backends,
'filter_function' and 'goodness_function', which can be used to filter
and weigh qualified backends, respectively.

Reference for cinder spec: I59b607a88953a346aa35e67e785a0417a7ce8cc9
Reference for cinder commit: I38408ab49b6ed869c1faae746ee64a3bae86be58

DocImpact
Change-Id: I873f4152e16efdeb30ceae26335a7974dc9b4b69
Implements: blueprint driver-filter-goodness-weigher

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-14 02:05:30.000000000', 'files': ['congressclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py', 'congressclient/openstack/common/apiclient/fake_client.py', 'congressclient/tests/test_base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I50234892bd3dadcda533d97c03414067e06ef0f4
Closes-Bug: #1586268
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I50234892bd3dadcda533d97c03414067e06ef0f4
Closes-Bug: #1586268

commit_message:
Added an parameter for neutron::agents::ml2::ovs to enable ovs-dpdk

puppet-vswitch will provide ovs and ovs with dpdk options.
ovs with dpdk has to be enabled only on compute nodes. Added
and option to configure via templates to enable dpdk.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I6cfd13d4979731696b09da52b2618fa33042403d

Correction in PLUMgrid plugin configurations

This change needs to be cherry-picked to stable/liberty and stable/mitaka as well.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-20 09:32:50.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were

because L3 agent was disabled.

Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Closes-Bug: 1583988
Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
(cherry picked from commit 887f35b0f1fcc2218636564948f36170ed077934)
