commit_message:
Ensure that Apache is installed

In order to use Apache, it must be installed. Somehow this got
missed in https://review.openstack.org/343918 - not sure how
it passed the tests either, but the Aodh role will not install
in the integrated build without this patch.

commit_message:
Change the repos to use upstream default

This changes the default repos scheme to use the upstream
default which is "http" instead of "https". This change is
in support of enabling packages to be cached instead of
proxied which will improve the speed of deployment.

Change-Id: I15111e60cb3e7e57ce4adabf870ff9d8c7d64f29
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix create container modal style

The input form included "Required" in the field, it isn't needed.
Also the checkbox didn't have the class of themable-checkbox,
this patch add the class suitable for OpenStack style.

Change-Id: I1fdf7bbd5511396f87339f5729104ea9c35dabe2
Closes-Bug: #1590914

subject: Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-21 06:25:20.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/test_resource2.py', 'openstack/resource2.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits.py'], 'message': 'Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component

The _transpose_component method needs to be adjusted as it currently
causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

An easy fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its
uses in the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests
were mocking it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

However, as just removing allows extraneous keys into our internal
dictionaries, switching _transpose_component to more of a filter model
is a better solution. This way we only return a dictionary including
keys that we're expecting to actually work with, rather than letting
everything possible in, which a simple removal would do. One example of
a place where this approach to the fix matters is in the Keypair
resource, where we are ignoring the "id" key that is both
inconsistently available and contains inconsistent values. That
resource looks to the "name" key as both the name attribute and an
alternate id, which this change supports properly. Just removing
_transpose_component reintroduces the inconsistent `id` internally,
which then makes it possible to access it via the `id` attribute on
Keypair, which breaks the id/name separation and consistency.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365
'}]
commit_message:
Replace _transpose_component with _filter_component

The _transpose_component method needs to be adjusted as it currently
causes attribute lookups on Resource instances to differ
depending on how they were constructed. This is an oversight from the
refactoring of this class, as data is stored internally using
server-side names instead of client-side names, but the
_transpose_component method was implemented when data was being stored
in client-side naming, i.e., how the Body and Header attributes are
named on Resource classes.

This oversight happened for two reasons:

1. The Resource.list call doesn't use _transpose_component but other
calls, e.g., Resource.get, do. At least for me, I find it easier during
sanity checks against a live OpenStack cloud to use the list methods,
look at instances in the list, and check certain attributes match what I
set them to. We don't have a strong functional test suite, but that's
where this would have been caught, as we'd be able to call list and then
get each of the items individually and ensure they have the same
values. Such a test would have failed as a number of attributes would
expect values and return None when retrieved via `get` calls.

2. The manual testing I had been doing in lieu of #1 was not
sufficiently thorough, as it was generally looking at only a few
attributes, and those attributes didn't require the _transpose_component
code path. When an attribute's client-side name matches the server-side
name, everything works fine regardless of how the underlying data was
obtained. So checking Server.status will always work, but
Server.created_at depends on how you got your response.

Given the following two calls:

a = list(conn.compute.servers())[0]
b = conn.compute.get_server(a.id)

`a.created_at` would work as expected, because Resource.list doesn't
call _transpose_component. The `created_at` attribute looks for a key
"created" that came from the server-side response data. Because
Resource.list wasn't transposing the data, it was stored appropriately
as "created" and the body manager knew to look in the dictionary for
"created" when a user access `a.created_at`.

However, `b.created_at` would not work as expected and would return
None. This is because Resource.get was sending the response body through
_transpose_component, which caused the "created" key to be stored
internally as "created_at". The body manager would then look for
"created" in the dictionary when looking at the mapping of client to
server names, and it wouldn't find anything beacuse we went against the
mapping and stored as a client name. It would thusly return the default
setting for that Body instance, which is None.

An easy fix is to just remove _transpose_component and all of its
uses in the Resource class as well as one subclass. Several tests
were mocking it out so they were also updated to remove the reference.

However, as just removing allows extraneous keys into our internal
dictionaries, switching _transpose_component to more of a filter model
is a better solution. This way we only return a dictionary including
keys that we're expecting to actually work with, rather than letting
everything possible in, which a simple removal would do. One example of
a place where this approach to the fix matters is in the Keypair
resource, where we are ignoring the "id" key that is both
inconsistently available and contains inconsistent values. That
resource looks to the "name" key as both the name attribute and an
alternate id, which this change supports properly. Just removing
_transpose_component reintroduces the inconsistent `id` internally,
which then makes it possible to access it via the `id` attribute on
Keypair, which breaks the id/name separation and consistency.

Change-Id: Ida7c68c78910ee7adc9d9b73ca9cf280bc303cf5
Closes-Bug: 1600365

commit_message:
Collate multiple commits to fix the gate

The gate fails because the clients/libraries the code
depends on were upgraded. Fix by merging the following
two commits.

commit 90e55779e9baa1e7cbdc6e0c737f32bb73721524
Author: Oleksii Chuprykov <ochuprykov@mirantis.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 18 15:29:18 2016 +0300

    Add direct_use=False flag to constructor of novaclient

    As we directly use novaclient class with particular version,
    we need to path direct_use=False to avoid fails.

    Change-Id: Ieb3dcd2b48a172a4e7ad55e44dcdf6329c8bcb0c
    Closes-Bug: #1603976

commit 0156e98e66c9a26649897f0e0b7cd0907cbebff5
Author: Dmitriy Uvarenkov <duvarenkov@mirantis.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 15 13:09:15 2016 +0300

    Fix stack deleting problem in magnum stacks

    In magnumclient/exceptions.py exceptions are imported
    from magnumclient.common.apiclient so exception class
    is not the same as expected in heat/engine/clients/os/magnum.py

    Closes-Bug: #1570781
    Change-Id: Ie60a735470b9adc38675b613950e6480e28136ab

Closes-Bug: #1605617
Change-Id: Ie4519584a0be6e399a08ca281e8e0f4049c52720

commit_message:
Remove update_flavor method from compute

update_flavor API is not supported by nova and raises
HttpException: Bad Request if called from openstacksdk,
hence removed this method to cleanup the source code.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21784, 'name': 'Radek Zetik', 'email': 'radekx.zetik@intel.com', 'username': 'rzetikx'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-18 12:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'Spread instances across NUMA nodes

NUMA placement criteria is undefined and produces unexpected behavior.

This patch fixes how instances are placed over NUMA nodes. The current
behavior has undesired effects, as packing all instances to node 0: e.g:
when hw:numa_nodes=1, the result was to pack all instances on node 0,
leaving the other nodes free (unused):
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node0, instance3 --> node0

The new criteria optimizes NUMA usage by spreading instances across all
NUMA nodes, by choosing/favoring the less packed ones:
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node1, instance3 --> node2

Some other possible criteria are: packing or random. A new config setting
in the flavor or image metadata is required to implement those, though.
Also, for packing, there are some (non-trivial) changes required to make
the cell node accountable, by updating host_cell.avail_cpus.

Change-Id: I2bb9887184827340f059b1229ca2df146fe6a7c4
Closes-Bug: #1601994
'}]
commit_message:
Spread instances across NUMA nodes

NUMA placement criteria is undefined and produces unexpected behavior.

This patch fixes how instances are placed over NUMA nodes. The current
behavior has undesired effects, as packing all instances to node 0: e.g:
when hw:numa_nodes=1, the result was to pack all instances on node 0,
leaving the other nodes free (unused):
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node0, instance3 --> node0

The new criteria optimizes NUMA usage by spreading instances across all
NUMA nodes, by choosing/favoring the less packed ones:
instance1 --> node0, instance2 --> node1, instance3 --> node2

Some other possible criteria are: packing or random. A new config setting
in the flavor or image metadata is required to implement those, though.
Also, for packing, there are some (non-trivial) changes required to make
the cell node accountable, by updating host_cell.avail_cpus.

Change-Id: I2bb9887184827340f059b1229ca2df146fe6a7c4
Closes-Bug: #1601994

Change-Id: Ie48bee09897dc6ef9de1888d2bfa32e40b4d7255

commit_message:
Use Puppet package provider to update OpenStack packages

Instead of using 'yum update' Exec resource to update all packages, use
Puppet package resource collector, so Puppet OpenStack modules will
notify correctly the services that have been updated and db_sync will be
executed.

Change-Id: Ie48bee09897dc6ef9de1888d2bfa32e40b4d7255

subject: Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-19 23:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rabbitmq_ssl_user_provided.yml'], 'message': "Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9 the
task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Separate the task deploying a user provided ssl cert and key into two
and check them individually for 'rabbitmq_user_ssl_cert' or
'rabbitmq_user_ssl_key' being defined.

Change-Id: I68afa3066ad88ecae95fcb29c78764d02dc38627
"}]
commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9 the
task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Separate the task deploying a user provided ssl cert and key into two
and check them individually for 'rabbitmq_user_ssl_cert' or
'rabbitmq_user_ssl_key' being defined.

Change-Id: I68afa3066ad88ecae95fcb29c78764d02dc38627

commit_message:

- the router name
- the auth url
- the username
- the password
- the tenant name

subject: Cluster tests get the instance flavor
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-20 02:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/cluster_actions_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_create_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/test_runners.py'], 'message': 'Cluster tests get the instance flavor

Cluster tests rely on the instance flavor to be set
already. This works when the single instance tests
run before (they initialize it) but not when
running cluster tests standalone.

Make cluster tests retrieve the flavor themselves.

Change-Id: I8bac99fecc9508bb5452169836e8c28a3e3a92b5
'}]
commit_message:
Cluster tests get the instance flavor

Cluster tests rely on the instance flavor to be set
already. This works when the single instance tests
run before (they initialize it) but not when
running cluster tests standalone.

Make cluster tests retrieve the flavor themselves.

Change-Id: I8bac99fecc9508bb5452169836e8c28a3e3a92b5

commit_message:
Deploy MySQL using composable role

in THT.

commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Deprecated configuration using oslo_messaging_rabbit has been replaced
with transport_url based configuration

Change-Id: Ic1eb3bb6346ebdaa0d3bc19a879946c527239dfb
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

In some profiles, we were looking up the $step by using Hiera
again, while we already do it in the parameter definition.
When using this class outside THT, it will fail but with this patch, we
could use just set the $step parameter and the rest of the manifest will
work.

Change-Id: I7082f47204fb4e529b164e4c4f1032e7bdd88f02

commit_message:
use parameter to lookup the step instead of hiera again

In some profiles, we were looking up the $step by using Hiera
again, while we already do it in the parameter definition.
When using this class outside THT, it will fail but with this patch, we
could use just set the $step parameter and the rest of the manifest will
work.

Change-Id: I7082f47204fb4e529b164e4c4f1032e7bdd88f02

commit_message:

the addition of Xenial support as well as adding more

commit_message:
Implemented package caching on the repo server

This change implements package caching on the repo server.
To take advantage of this a deploy will need to do nothing more
than setup an apt-proxy configuration file. This will speed up
package delivery while also providing ha capabilities within the
environment.

Change-Id: I78b2fba6a1f294751bd7098513060015cb41300c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Change the repos to use upstream default

This changes the default repos scheme to use the upstream
default which is "http" instead of "https". This change is
in support of enabling packages to be cached instead of
proxied which will improve the speed of deployment.

Change-Id: I67a9fb48ee08866bd59d70730e62b7da28f81125
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add .gitreview and clean up repo

Add src/README.md placeholder to prevent inheritence of the
base layer's readme file in the built charm.

Use the official charms.openstack repo in test-requirements.txt.

Use official designate charm location in the Amulet tests.

Remove upload-and-publish so as not to encourage out-of-band
pushing and publishing.  That is handled by CI.

Remove legacy Makefile.

Rename Amulet test files and drop Icehouse on the Trusty target.

Update tox.ini for Amulet environment variables.

Update metadata.yaml, removing EOL release and adding tags.

Fix apt_pkg mock

Disable py27 unit tests

Change-Id: I5220b73eb41e42cb03e6dac27525140fb21ca449

commit_message:
Fix directory ownership as part of upgrade

This change ensures that when ceph is upgraded from an
older version that uses root to a newer version that
uses ceph as the process owner that all directories
are chowned.

Closes-Bug: 1600338
Change-Id: I162ebdbeee0d7bae4866b6462f98f11e3892b7ba

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-19 16:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/set_guest_time-736939fe725cbdab.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_guest.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'message': "libvirt: update guest time after suspend

When an instance is resumed from suspension or a migration, the guest's
clock might get a large delay between the current and the suspension time.
In some cases, NTP might not be able to resynchronize the guest time and
will result in a skewed clock.

In order to address the issue, this patch will try to set the guest time
after it is resumed. This operation will require the guest agent to be
configured and running in order to be able to run. However, this operation
will not be disruptive.

This code is similar to a change that has been commited to oVirt.
https://gerrit.ovirt.org/#/c/50426

Closes-Bug: #1593745
Change-Id: I2732af50aab238502ccdc067f62290fd962c8c64
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: update guest time after suspend

When an instance is resumed from suspension or a migration, the guest's
clock might get a large delay between the current and the suspension time.
In some cases, NTP might not be able to resynchronize the guest time and
will result in a skewed clock.

In order to address the issue, this patch will try to set the guest time
after it is resumed. This operation will require the guest agent to be
configured and running in order to be able to run. However, this operation
will not be disruptive.

This code is similar to a change that has been commited to oVirt.
https://gerrit.ovirt.org/#/c/50426

Closes-Bug: #1593745
Change-Id: I2732af50aab238502ccdc067f62290fd962c8c64

older version that uses root to a newer version that
uses ceph as the process owner that all directories
are chowned.

Current capacity reporting is based on logical values which can
differ significantly from real usage with e.g. sparse files.
This change switches to using physical values and includes free
space correction based on a Quobyte volumes internal replication
factor.
Closes-Bug: #1603434

Change-Id: I74ae2974709a13697412f43a448582be56c21e63
'}]
commit_message:
Correct Quobyte driver capacity reporting

Current capacity reporting is based on logical values which can
differ significantly from real usage with e.g. sparse files.
This change switches to using physical values and includes free
space correction based on a Quobyte volumes internal replication
factor.
Closes-Bug: #1603434

Change-Id: I74ae2974709a13697412f43a448582be56c21e63

commit_message:
Changes around keystone-manage commands

* perform all keystone-manage commands only as keystone user
* as it possible to override keystone user in init class
  we should also have an ability to override it in db::sync class
* ensure that fernet key directory is created before fernet
  setup command and it's owned by keystone user

Closes-bug: #1604884

Change-Id: Ib90d8e2259b9a650a2edb5f0baf0e68451b9abf6

commit_message:
Move mysql::host param from MysqlInternal to MysqlNoBracketsInternal

The ::host parameter expects IPv6 addresses withouth brackets; this
change aligns the remaining services to use MysqlNoBracketsInternal
as it happens already for the others (eg. Keystone).

Change-Id: Ia72d325447408b1cb5fea836034bbcd75d17ddf1

commit_message:
Add .gitreview and clean up repo

Add src/README.md placeholder to prevent inheritence of the
base layer's readme file in the built charm.

Use the official charms.openstack repo in test-requirements.txt.

Use official designate-bind charm location in the Amulet tests.

Remove upload-and-publish so as not to encourage out-of-band
pushing and publishing.  That is handled by CI.

Fix unit tests

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 10:48:56.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Disable skip_git_sdist flag

This flag prevents other files except python module
to be put in the tarball when running command
python setup.py sdist. However when building rpm/deb packages
we need all files to be in the tarball.

Closes-Bug: #1604005
'}]
commit_message:
Disable skip_git_sdist flag

This flag prevents other files except python module
to be put in the tarball when running command
python setup.py sdist. However when building rpm/deb packages
we need all files to be in the tarball.

Change-Id: I10ac546f2dbc214743c7bef65cb032b8ccbe0182
Closes-Bug: #1604005

subject: Skip pingtest cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-21 17:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Skip pingtest cleanup

We're spending around 2 minutes per run cleaning up the pingtest
resources in an environment that will be deleted immediately
afterwards.  While there's some small chance of this finding a bug
in the overcloud services, we're deploying a very simple Heat stack
so IMHO the slim chances of this finding a bug are not worth the
time it's taking.

Change-Id: I9b39bb6070baa956db283f5a7691385173290e6d
"}]
commit_message:
Skip pingtest cleanup

We're spending around 2 minutes per run cleaning up the pingtest
resources in an environment that will be deleted immediately
afterwards.  While there's some small chance of this finding a bug
in the overcloud services, we're deploying a very simple Heat stack
so IMHO the slim chances of this finding a bug are not worth the
time it's taking.

Change-Id: I9b39bb6070baa956db283f5a7691385173290e6d

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-22 06:30:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/glossary.rst'], 'message': '[glossary] fixed a grammatical mistake

There is a grammatical mistake in the term of "DNS" in Glossary of
OpenStack End User Guide:
  "Associates a human-friendly names to IP addresses."
An adjective pair added:
  "Associates human-friendly, domain names to IP addresses."
Thank Darren Chan and Joseph Robinson for the suggestions.

Closes-Bug: #1605210
Change-Id: I94f2b81719a74d8c046f6a32225ae557027500d9
'}]
commit_message:
[glossary] fixed a grammatical mistake

There is a grammatical mistake in the term of "DNS" in Glossary of
OpenStack End User Guide:
  "Associates a human-friendly names to IP addresses."
An adjective pair added:
  "Associates human-friendly, domain names to IP addresses."
Thank Darren Chan and Joseph Robinson for the suggestions.

Closes-Bug: #1605210
Change-Id: I94f2b81719a74d8c046f6a32225ae557027500d9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-20 05:30:24.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/baremetal.py'], 'message': 'Handle empty list of introspected nodes

It seems that if there are no nodes to introspect, the value we get
is an empty list instead of an empty dict. Which is not what we
expect. So this CR fixes that.

Change-Id: I72edd4633d32119eb5f39fb45f8e40ee715eb888
Closes-Bug: #1604371
'}]
commit_message:
Handle empty list of introspected nodes

It seems that if there are no nodes to introspect, the value we get
is an empty list instead of an empty dict. Which is not what we
expect. So this CR fixes that.

Change-Id: I72edd4633d32119eb5f39fb45f8e40ee715eb888
Closes-Bug: #1604371

commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily disable the tag-releases job"

This is dependent on having appropriate Gerrit credentials for an
account in the Release Managers group so that it can push tags
successfully. The dependency below adds that.

This reverts commit cbdb00865dc653275243273cf2949e0c53c8a88b.

Change-Id: I7db1625e85bce5609e4ec2a39e78abb9cd59fa9d
Depends-On: Ibf203b71226a672f707e87f22cbf4990b2ebb003

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 11:52:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': "Disable telemetry configuration for all services

The deployment of all telemetry services was disabled in
https://review.openstack.org/344345 - but all services
being configured to use them which is causing build

Change-Id: I6b4858baf25410d18e3019ae306f0dbef483218e

commit_message:
Disable telemetry configuration for all services

The deployment of all telemetry services was disabled in
https://review.openstack.org/344345 - but all services
being configured to use them which is causing build
failures.

This patch ensures that it's all completely disabled.

Change-Id: I6b4858baf25410d18e3019ae306f0dbef483218e

commit_message:
[k8s] Save gateway node ip before its release for proper reporting

During scaling gateways down, reporter was trying to get ip of the
instance which was already released and that caused index error.
This patch saves this ip for report before releasing resourses.

Change-Id: I9310a423b1ad8c488c1cc7400844ae5d8767879c
Closes-bug: #1590728
(cherry picked from commit 3c393ba7c6e63c93018ffa7f422ee9a7ceb5fbce)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-15 13:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/test_account.py', 'test/functional/test_object.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/functional/test_container.py'], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in functional tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I80ec96e0b729bef38213a6be4ff4b6eb65c7612d
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in functional tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I80ec96e0b729bef38213a6be4ff4b6eb65c7612d

subject: use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:08:10.000000000', 'files': ['translator/common/images.py', 'requirements.txt', 'translator/hot/tosca/tosca_compute.py', 'translator/hot/tosca/tests/test_tosca_compute.py', 'translator/tests/test_shell.py', 'translator/shell.py', 'translator/osc/v1/translate.py', 'translator/osc/v1/tests/fakes.py', 'translator/common/flavors.py'], 'message': 'use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients

The parser should not rely on the OS_* environment variables for
authentication, as it will fail with more complex setups, when using the
"clouds.yaml" configuration file or when being called through osc with
arguments instead of environment variables.

Moreover, the client should not use "requests" directly to do GETs to
access the nova flavors and glance images, but it should use the
existing clients.

When used through the python-openstackclient it is possible to force the
client to request authentication. The authentication will be handled by
the client, so that the parser does not need to worry about it (so that
authentication plugins can be used). Then, the existing authentication
session can be reused for all the client interaction with OpenStack to
fetch the flavor and images information.

Change-Id: I9f65e7d46686c37bb44ef18756ebd295ee4961de
'}]
commit_message:
use keystoneauth and OpenStack clients

The parser should not rely on the OS_* environment variables for
authentication, as it will fail with more complex setups, when using the
"clouds.yaml" configuration file or when being called through osc with
arguments instead of environment variables.

Moreover, the client should not use "requests" directly to do GETs to
access the nova flavors and glance images, but it should use the
existing clients.

When used through the python-openstackclient it is possible to force the
client to request authentication. The authentication will be handled by
the client, so that the parser does not need to worry about it (so that
authentication plugins can be used). Then, the existing authentication
session can be reused for all the client interaction with OpenStack to
fetch the flavor and images information.

Change-Id: I9f65e7d46686c37bb44ef18756ebd295ee4961de

subject: Provide pci whitelist for the DPDK_OPTIONS for ovs
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:13:50.000000000', 'files': ['lib/facter/pci_address.rb', 'spec/classes/vswitch_dpdk_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/ovs-dpdk-97916bffadb9d594.yaml', 'manifests/dpdk.pp'], 'message': 'Provide pci whitelist for the DPDK_OPTIONS for ovs

To use DPDK, nics has to be bind with DPDK drivers. Once
binded, the nics will not be listed in the kernel commands.
We have to update the list of PCI address of the nics which
are bound to the DPDK drivers with openvswtich DPDK_OPTIONS
as whitelist. For which, the list of PCI address of the
nics which are bound to the given DPDK drivers are listed
via a custom facter. This whitelist is fed as input to the
DPDK_OPTIONS.

Co-Authored-By: Jaganathan Palanisamy <jpalanis@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I4fbca23e07468ee58dfce10a6deaf2f25da654c7
'}]
commit_message:
Provide pci whitelist for the DPDK_OPTIONS for ovs

To use DPDK, nics has to be bind with DPDK drivers. Once
binded, the nics will not be listed in the kernel commands.
We have to update the list of PCI address of the nics which
are bound to the DPDK drivers with openvswtich DPDK_OPTIONS
as whitelist. For which, the list of PCI address of the
nics which are bound to the given DPDK drivers are listed
via a custom facter. This whitelist is fed as input to the
DPDK_OPTIONS.

Co-Authored-By: Jaganathan Palanisamy <jpalanis@redhat.com>

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ovs-dpdk

Change-Id: I4fbca23e07468ee58dfce10a6deaf2f25da654c7

commit_message:
Huawei: Support reporting disk type of pool

Adding support for reporting disk type of pool in huawei cinder
driver. When creating volume we can specify the disk type of the
pool we want to use ssd/sas/nl_sas/mix, cinder driver will report
the disk type of the pools.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint huawei-pool-disktype-support
Change-Id: I10bbcf18ba04bdbb61a88e23cf4ec88c05b2c38d

commit_message:
[kubernetes] Create actions to recreate pods and restart containers

This patch adds actions to KubernetesPod class which allow to
recreate a pod (delete it and create new one) and to restart docker
containers on minion nodes.

Change-Id: Ia03b27d72662700fb302960adba9dae20203b597
Closes-bug: #1466359

commit_message:
Add 'service_name' to composable services

This patch adds a new service_name section to each composable
service. We now have an explicit unit test check to ensure that
service_name exists in tools/yaml-validate.py.

This patch also wires service_names into hieradata on each
of the roles so that tools can access the deployed services locally
during deployment and upgrades.

Change-Id: I60861c5aa760534db3e314bba16a13b90ea72f0c

commit_message:
Could not invoke static methods from Python

Static method were handled incorrectly when
called from Python because of incorrect
method receiver.

Change-Id: Id7ef2bc0c74154bd3ac6ef7dcf8fa807a4be757b
Closes-Bug: #1596613
(cherry picked from commit 75bded129e66a75cf6d760ce825571cc3a2dc45d)

Make more-less js get dynamic-ui form description trim space

commit_message:
Extract `etc` files from openstack packages

Extract the required files from openstack packages instead of installing
the entire set of packages. This cuts the image size by ~500MB.

Change-Id: Id5a2519d5471c25b44c3ad7ce441d9bae3cae651

commit_message:
Correction in PLUMgrid plugin configurations

This patch set corrects some configurations in PLUMgrid neutron plugin to support l2gateway feature.

Doc-ref: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PLUMgrid-Neutron

This change needs to be cherry-picked to stable/liberty and stable/mitaka as well.

Change-Id: I7aba9d59a0422104260f4e1f1d5c20279ae552e2

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-21 13:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/newton_deprecate_enable_tunneling-d7f6e2de1091b458.yaml', 'spec/acceptance/basic_neutron_spec.rb', 'examples/neutron.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp'], 'message': "Remove unused enable_tunneling in openvswitch_agent.ini

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1531890, the ovs
agent does not use the 'agent_tunneling' setting in openvswitch_agent.ini,
instead it uses 'tunnel_types'.  This fix removes it from being set in
the .ini file and also sets local_ip, tunnel_bridge, etc. based on the
'tunnel_types' hieradata parameter.  The hieradata 'enable_tunneling'
is being removed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335235/.

Partial-Bug: 1532830

Change-Id: I73630653330c67444827f32740c44e9d25b5db31
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused enable_tunneling in openvswitch_agent.ini

As described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1531890, the ovs
agent does not use the 'agent_tunneling' setting in openvswitch_agent.ini,
instead it uses 'tunnel_types'.  This fix removes it from being set in
the .ini file and also sets local_ip, tunnel_bridge, etc. based on the
'tunnel_types' hieradata parameter.  The hieradata 'enable_tunneling'
is being removed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/335235/.

Partial-Bug: 1532830

Change-Id: I73630653330c67444827f32740c44e9d25b5db31

commit_message:
Setup more strict permissions for sensible data

This change sets more strict permissions for data in the:
 - /etc/hiera
 - /etc/facter
 - /etc/fuel/cluster

Change-Id: Ie652f6d323088321ce9dae468df527457328b69e
Closes-Bug: #1603182
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate is_admin option from Keystone mw config in Swift proxy

This option has been deprecated some time ago, and finally been removed
in Mitaka. Let's deprecate this setting in puppet-swift too; there is no
longer a reason to use it from Mitaka on. This patch makes it a noop
parameter.

See Id6bc10c3e84262c0a9e6160a76af03c0ad363e9c in Swift for reference.

Change-Id: I525f5010d56ccdd205a0f9d55db99b0f359f35c3
Co-Authored-By: Pete Zaitcev <zaitcev@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Setup more strict permissions for sensible data

This change sets more strict permissions for data in the:
 - /etc/hiera
 - /etc/facter
 - /etc/fuel/cluster

Change-Id: Ie652f6d323088321ce9dae468df527457328b69e
Closes-Bug: #1603182
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Support services which listen on multiple ports

The APIConfigurationAdapter assumed that a service would only listen
on one port but many OpenStack services will listen on multiple ports
often seperating admin traffic from general traffic.

commit_message:
Fix parameters of assertEqual are misplaced

Many assertEqual sentences don't follow assertEqual(expected, actual),
These misplaces have 2 impacts:
1, giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2, mislead other developers, new test modules may follow these wrong pattern.

This patch fix all of them.

Change-Id: Ie9da006cc561e5266812db2bb1c03a624b5e844b
Closes-Bug: #1604213

revisions:
[{'number': 42, 'created': '2016-07-19 13:46:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/exception.py'], 'message': 'Update binding:profile for SR-IOV ports

The libvirt driver relies on the network information for configuring the
SR-IOV interfaces (binding:vnic_type). The network information is specified
when creating a Neutron port (binding:profile - which contain the PCI address
of the device).

During a migration, the Neutron port information needs to be updated based on
the allocated PCI device on the migrated node.

Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>

Closes-Bug: #1512880

Change-Id: I7423907ef33648669decc561fc3461415b877ba6
'}]
commit_message:
Update binding:profile for SR-IOV ports

The libvirt driver relies on the network information for configuring the
SR-IOV interfaces (binding:vnic_type). The network information is specified
when creating a Neutron port (binding:profile - which contain the PCI address
of the device).

During a migration, the Neutron port information needs to be updated based on
the allocated PCI device on the migrated node.

Co-Authored-By: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>

Closes-Bug: #1512880

Change-Id: I7423907ef33648669decc561fc3461415b877ba6

Add support for creating and managing Sahara templates

This patch add possibility to manage Sahara templates via OSC:
node group templates and cluster templates. Also added tests.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9029, 'name': 'Moshe Elisha', 'email': 'moshe.elisha@nokia.com', 'username': 'MosheElisha'}, {'_account_id': 9408, 'name': 'Michal Gershenzon', 'email': 'michal.gershenzon@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mgershen'}, {'_account_id': 18238, 'name': 'Hardik Parekh', 'email': 'hardik.parekh047@gmail.com', 'username': 'hparekh'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-21 07:52:21.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/controllers/v2/resources.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/execution.py', 'mistral/api/controllers/v2/task.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_executions.py'], 'message': 'Add the new endpoint /v2/tasks/<id>/workflow_executions

* This new endpoint is needed to be able to navigate through a workflow
  tree from parent workflows down to nested workflows
* This endpoint is added for symmetry with
  /v2/tasks/<id>/action_executions
* Added the new module resources.py under mistral.api.controllers.v2
  package in order to break a circular dependency between execution.py
  and task.py because use classes from each other. As a rule for further
  development, we'll need to keep all resources separately (and move
  existing ones to resources.py module) and define all sub-controllers
  (like "tasks of a workflow execution", or /v2/executions/<id>/tasks)
  in same modules as main controllers. That will help avoid circular
  dependencies and provide a straightforward grouping.

TODO:
* Add convenience /v2/tasks/<id>/executions endpoint as described in the BP
* Move all REST resources to resources.py module
* Move all sub-controllers to same modules as main controllers
* Move REST data types (e.g SCOPE_TYPES and STATE_TYPES) to types.py

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-task-subexecutions-endpoint

Change-Id: I6cbcd83cf9ac4ad5c38bda435c3b2300c42043ef
'}]
commit_message:
Add the new endpoint /v2/tasks/<id>/workflow_executions

* This new endpoint is needed to be able to navigate through a workflow
  tree from parent workflows down to nested workflows
* This endpoint is added for symmetry with
  /v2/tasks/<id>/action_executions
* Added the new module resources.py under mistral.api.controllers.v2
  package in order to break a circular dependency between execution.py
  and task.py because use classes from each other. As a rule for further
  development, we'll need to keep all resources separately (and move
  existing ones to resources.py module) and define all sub-controllers
  (like "tasks of a workflow execution", or /v2/executions/<id>/tasks)
  in same modules as main controllers. That will help avoid circular
  dependencies and provide a straightforward grouping.

TODO:
* Add convenience /v2/tasks/<id>/executions endpoint as described in the BP
* Move all REST resources to resources.py module
* Move all sub-controllers to same modules as main controllers
* Move REST data types (e.g SCOPE_TYPES and STATE_TYPES) to types.py

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-task-subexecutions-endpoint

Change-Id: I6cbcd83cf9ac4ad5c38bda435c3b2300c42043ef

commit_message:
Django 1.8

Migrate from 1.6 to community selected:
    1.8<= vesion < 1.9
Version 1.8 is LTS

On driver load:
    'devops.driver.libvirt.libvirt_driver' has been marked as
    deprecated and renamed to 'devops.driver.libvirt'

Closes-bug: #1373381
blueprint fuel-qa-python3-compatibility

Change-Id: I38c99db5f4dc53c56c4dd22ed679ca1f01979848
(cherry picked from commit 99cd80f)

Allow configuration of multiple rabbit clusters

In the mitaka release, neutron enabled configuring
separate transport_url values for RPC and notification
messaging.

Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Make LBaaSv2 service_provider configurable

This patch makes the service_provider line for LBaaSv2 configurable.
When Octavia is ready, this should allow for a fairly easy switch
from LBaaSv2 with an agent to Octavia.

Change-Id: I4a185406b26d30b383c08d39612138d52f88e60b

commit_message:
Remove LBaaSv1

The LBaaSv1 code was deprecated in Liberty and was removed from
neutron-lbaas in the Newton release. This patch removes all of
the LBaaSv1 references from the neutron role.

Change-Id: Ib4b6ccfe578d3c760b0b37e63c1dbd1e75a2d26b

subject: Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-21 21:09:57.000000000', 'files': ['templates/heat.conf.j2', 'tests/test.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Introduced new variables so the transport_url values
used for RPC and notifications can vary. By default
they will remain the same.

Change-Id: I0a3d7130493d8a0c46cf0695cbe98a94657ca0a7
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters
'}]
commit_message:
Support service-specific rabbitmq clusters

All rabbitmq connection vars are now namespaced. Namespace support
was previously inconsistent which limited deployer override options.

Introduced new variables so the transport_url values
used for RPC and notifications can vary. By default
they will remain the same.

Change-Id: I0a3d7130493d8a0c46cf0695cbe98a94657ca0a7
Implements: blueprint multi-rabbitmq-clusters

commit_message:
Add supports-upgrade and follows-standard-deprecation to Ironic

Ironic has supported both of these tags for some time now, however did
not have upgrade testign until recently. Now that we have upgrade
testing voting on our gate, let's add these tags officially.

Change-Id: I07fc7a60ae8ea1c18aa00a704ee33310f47964c7

commit_message:
show the new version early in the list-changes output

To properly evaluate the changes in the new release we need to know the
version number. As the output of list-changes has evolved, that
information has been pushed down from the top of the report, so add it
back to an earlier title.

Change-Id: I57f026823e9f90a5a4eacfe7035b8837791afc3e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 07:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['tools/generate_driver_list.py'], 'message': "Remove generate_driver_list dependency on cur dir

tools/generate_driver_list.py assumes that the current directory is
the Cinder root directory. If the script is run from a different
directory, it doesn't generate the driver info. This patch changes
the current directory to the root directory before calling the
utility functions to generate the driver list.

Closes-bug: #1604269
Change-Id: I35829003868531ccd76ee26e83e0b51067984a6a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove generate_driver_list dependency on cur dir

tools/generate_driver_list.py assumes that the current directory is
the Cinder root directory. If the script is run from a different
directory, it doesn't generate the driver info. This patch changes
the current directory to the root directory before calling the
utility functions to generate the driver list.

Closes-bug: #1604269
Change-Id: I35829003868531ccd76ee26e83e0b51067984a6a

subject: show the governance tags for a deliverable in list-changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-13 17:01:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/list_changes.py'], 'message': 'show the governance tags for a deliverable in list-changes

Sometimes evaluating the changes requires knowing how the deliverables
are set up in the governance repository. For example, releases from
"stable" branches of projects that do not claim to follow the stable
release process can be evaluated more leniently.

Change-Id: I9337d5ab77bcfc302af65f755a801f8b20f839f9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
show the governance tags for a deliverable in list-changes

Sometimes evaluating the changes requires knowing how the deliverables
are set up in the governance repository. For example, releases from
"stable" branches of projects that do not claim to follow the stable
release process can be evaluated more leniently.

Change-Id: I9337d5ab77bcfc302af65f755a801f8b20f839f9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add milestone-checkup command

Add a command for comparing the deliverables using the
cycle-with-milestone release model and the actual releases listed in the
releases repository. We can use this to identify projects that have
missed their milestone release.

Change-Id: Idc995093a4320b5c22d4af9b989300afcf631ec3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-15 14:31:29.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': "force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging

zuul-cloner may be using an out of date cache, and may have pointed
originally at a repo on a zuul merger that doesn't have all tags. Force
an update of all remotes and fetch all tags to make sure they are
present before we start trying to add any new ones.

Change-Id: I29cdae3ff8195e4b7e35ac486429394f17919bff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
force a fuller update of the repo being cloned for tagging

zuul-cloner may be using an out of date cache, and may have pointed
originally at a repo on a zuul merger that doesn't have all tags. Force
an update of all remotes and fetch all tags to make sure they are
present before we start trying to add any new ones.

Change-Id: I29cdae3ff8195e4b7e35ac486429394f17919bff
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Pin to a lower version of store release
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-22 07:14:54.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Pin to a lower version of store release

Due to some translation changes not being formatted correctly, the
latest glance_store release is resulting into glance docs gate to fail.

This is blocking reviews on glance and we don't have a concerete
solution on the underlying changes in oslo.config/oslosphinx or
elsewhere required.

This is the best attempt to unblock glance reviews.

Change-Id: I9f51741e1ce1d37b9d6fd1c58c6754317d25ced9
ref: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-July/thread.html#8899
"}]
commit_message:
Pin to a lower version of store release

Due to some translation changes not being formatted correctly, the
latest glance_store release is resulting into glance docs gate to fail.

This is blocking reviews on glance and we don't have a concerete
solution on the underlying changes in oslo.config/oslosphinx or
elsewhere required.

This is the best attempt to unblock glance reviews.

Change-Id: I9f51741e1ce1d37b9d6fd1c58c6754317d25ced9
ref: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-July/thread.html#8899

subject: Metadata definitions table with pagination shows inconsistent data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 12:14:29.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/metadata_defs/views.py'], 'message': 'Metadata definitions table with pagination shows inconsistent data

When using the prev_marker, we ordered the list by desc and
then applied a sort based on the namespace but we used
reverse=True, making the list always being return in the
incorrect order.

Change-Id: If83bc51793a1c5064318770f976c13a0ca3adf62
Closes-Bug: 1560279
'}]
commit_message:
Metadata definitions table with pagination shows inconsistent data

When using the prev_marker, we ordered the list by desc and
then applied a sort based on the namespace but we used
reverse=True, making the list always being return in the
incorrect order.

Change-Id: If83bc51793a1c5064318770f976c13a0ca3adf62
Closes-Bug: 1560279

subject: Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-22 09:36:46.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rabbitmq_ssl_user_provided.yml'], 'message': "Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9
the task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I8e67ec8d524b4498b7eb821f5fd03d07bd08555e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix deprecation warning for undefined variables

'with_' clauses are evaluated before 'when' clauses. In Ansible 1.9
the task is silently skipped when a variable within a 'with_' clause is
undefined, Ansible 2 provides a deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I8e67ec8d524b4498b7eb821f5fd03d07bd08555e

commit_message:
Add another workaround for snapshots

in snapshot jobs, there is a need to parse
fullDisplayName field and remove 9.x from
there.

Closes-bug: #1603088

subject: Use python-jobs in a few places
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-21 19:23:43.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Use python-jobs in a few places

os-api-ref and requirements repositories use all jobs defined in the
python-jobs template with the exception of the branch-tarball one. For
consistency, use the python-jobs template, thus adding the tarball job
to it.

This needs supporting changes for jjb files.

Change-Id: Id827415d7aab926dacd76c52c9e3f96e7c35ed75
'}]
commit_message:
Use python-jobs in a few places

os-api-ref and requirements repositories use all jobs defined in the
python-jobs template with the exception of the branch-tarball one. For
consistency, use the python-jobs template, thus adding the tarball job
to it.

This needs supporting changes for jjb files.

Change-Id: Id827415d7aab926dacd76c52c9e3f96e7c35ed75

Add a attribute "access_project_id" for flavor object to
display the access project id list by using "flavor show"
command.

commit_message:
Update the ACLs for a port update only if necessary

There is no need to delete ACLs and recreate in cases where the
port update doesn't have any port security group changes.

commit_message:
Modify the range of weight in member

Weight in member is created with the range [0,256],
and usually it is [0,255]
'weight': {'allow_post': True, 'allow_put': True,
           'default': 1,
           'validate': {'type:range': [0, 256]},
           'convert_to': attr.convert_to_int,
           'is_visible': True},

Change-Id: If044bd18405e7e94f2c4eb0b75abe59f6e2efe2a
Closes-Bug:1598337

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Check if multinode Grenade CI will catch the incompatibility.

Change RPC argument to server-agent communication in incompatible way.
See if Grenade CI testing will show that this kind of change is forbidden
in rolling upgrades approach.

subject: Remove two races during the L->M Keystone under httpd migration
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:40:07.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh'], 'message': "Remove two races during the L->M Keystone under httpd migration

After adding the upgrade step to migrate keystone under httpd, we
left two small races in process:
1) The first race could result in the following error:
Graceful restart requested, doing restart (98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to address 192.0.2.14:35357

This is likely caused by removing the keystone resource and
changing constraints in a single pacemaker CIB transaction.
We are not guaranteed that pacemaker will first remove keystone
and then attempt to restart httpd due to the changed constraints.
To address this we unmanage the httpd resource before the constraint
changes and we remanage it later.

2) The second race is because after the cib-push we were not
guaranteed that the later upgrade step that reloads the httpd
configuration via 'systemctl reload httpd' was run after
httpd was started everywhere and we could get the following error:
07 07:51:14 overcloud-controller-0 systemd[1]: Unit httpd.service cannot be reloaded because it is inactive.

We add a check_resource httpd started after we remanage the httpd
resource, in order to guarantee that the httpd resource is up and
running at this point.

This should also fix RHBZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1348831

Closes-Bug: #1599798

Change-Id: I63871607d748068837c622fd08f2bfef120d27b7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove two races during the L->M Keystone under httpd migration

After adding the upgrade step to migrate keystone under httpd, we
left two small races in process:
1) The first race could result in the following error:
Graceful restart requested, doing restart (98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to address 192.0.2.14:35357

This is likely caused by removing the keystone resource and
changing constraints in a single pacemaker CIB transaction.
We are not guaranteed that pacemaker will first remove keystone
and then attempt to restart httpd due to the changed constraints.
To address this we unmanage the httpd resource before the constraint
changes and we remanage it later.

2) The second race is because after the cib-push we were not
guaranteed that the later upgrade step that reloads the httpd
configuration via 'systemctl reload httpd' was run after
httpd was started everywhere and we could get the following error:
07 07:51:14 overcloud-controller-0 systemd[1]: Unit httpd.service cannot be reloaded because it is inactive.

We add a check_resource httpd started after we remanage the httpd
resource, in order to guarantee that the httpd resource is up and
running at this point.

This should also fix RHBZ: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1348831

Closes-Bug: #1599798

Change-Id: I63871607d748068837c622fd08f2bfef120d27b7

subject: openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Ji≈ô√≠ Str√°nsk√Ω', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-21 15:40:07.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_migrations.sh', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': 'openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true

The dummy openstack-core resource was meant to replace keystone so that
restarting keystone would not restart the whole cloud. When this
resource was introduced the paramter interleave=true was mistakenly left
out.

This causes a simple promote operation on the galera resource to restart
openstack-core and its children.

The change in master is done in puppet-tripleo because the resource
creation for the dummy resource was put there.

Change-Id: Ic590005a9419be87e6e6ea131b0ac0630c5afc19
Closes-Bug: 1603381
'}]
commit_message:
openstack-core resource does not have interleave=true

The dummy openstack-core resource was meant to replace keystone so that
restarting keystone would not restart the whole cloud. When this
resource was introduced the paramter interleave=true was mistakenly left
out.

This causes a simple promote operation on the galera resource to restart
openstack-core and its children.

The change in master is done in puppet-tripleo because the resource
creation for the dummy resource was put there.

Change-Id: Ic590005a9419be87e6e6ea131b0ac0630c5afc19
Closes-Bug: 1603381

commit_message:
Add error handler to FileReader

When uploading a directory of template files, sometimes a file may not be
readable.  Instead of showing a never-ending progress bar, tell the user that a
file wasn't readable.

Change-Id: I902a2a66962d4307b6d48b25b12dd3ea531d3455

- Omit comparing actual IP addresses in resources
(which differ from deployment to deployment).

commit_message:
Improve deployment performance on large clusters

Template the openstack-host-hostfile-setup script once locally and then
copy it to all other other hosts, rather than templating the script on
every host. In large deployments, this greatly reduces the running time
of the update hosts file tasks.

Change-Id: Ic4d2f5242e0ca15956b29615df1121ec3fac414a

subject: Optimise pip install tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-21 18:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_console_novnc_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_compute_powervm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_install.yml'], 'message': 'Optimise pip install tasks

Unlike the Ansible apt module, the Ansible pip module does not
recognise a with_items list and process all the items at once.

To optimise the pip install tasks, this patch replaces the use
of with_items with a join filter so that the pip install task
does an install with all the packages in a list, ensuring that
the execution is one action instead of many.

Change-Id: I17c230f3178f7227b56969e2654894d4b92108e3
'}]
commit_message:
Optimise pip install tasks

Unlike the Ansible apt module, the Ansible pip module does not
recognise a with_items list and process all the items at once.

To optimise the pip install tasks, this patch replaces the use
of with_items with a join filter so that the pip install task
does an install with all the packages in a list, ensuring that
the execution is one action instead of many.

Change-Id: I17c230f3178f7227b56969e2654894d4b92108e3

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2015-09-18 16:20:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Nova-manage command for cleaning volume attachment

Add a nova-manage command to make Nova gracefully clean up its own
attachment records when volumes are stuck in 'attaching' or 'detaching'
status.
This command will call the compute manager detach volume via rpc.
We want deliberately skip all the checks performed by
the nova API "detach_volume" as those checks prevent the deletion of the
volume records.
The idea is that operators should use this command in order to clean-up
the nova block device mapping table when a volume is stuck in a
'*-ing' status.
At the moment the only way to clean-up this situation is to manually
amend the DB.

Co-Authored-By: wanghao <wanghao749@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449221
DocImpact

Change-Id: I8022174ac311f588b669e1d4cf6704270ed12b94
'}]
commit_message:
Nova-manage command for cleaning volume attachment

Add a nova-manage command to make Nova gracefully clean up its own
attachment records when volumes are stuck in 'attaching' or 'detaching'
status.
This command will call the compute manager detach volume via rpc.
We want deliberately skip all the checks performed by
the nova API "detach_volume" as those checks prevent the deletion of the
volume records.
The idea is that operators should use this command in order to clean-up
the nova block device mapping table when a volume is stuck in a
'*-ing' status.
At the moment the only way to clean-up this situation is to manually
amend the DB.

Co-Authored-By: wanghao <wanghao749@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449221
DocImpact

Change-Id: I8022174ac311f588b669e1d4cf6704270ed12b94

commit_message:
Removing the infra_hosts and infra_containers groups

These inventory groups are not discussed in the documentation,
referenced in example config and their presence seems to be a
relic of the past.

Services that were previously within them seem to now be split
between the os-infra_* and shared-infra_* inventory groups.

Change-Id: I6f4ef7c73165be3058ebece56415958a80d4599c

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-07-21 17:18:06.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/os_nova-install-venv-6c6c2ba28f67a891.yaml', 'tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_compute_kvm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_console_novnc_install.yml', 'templates/nova-upstart-init.j2', 'tasks/nova_compute_powervm_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_install.yml', 'tasks/nova_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': 'Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of nova inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: Ia8687d49803705702f0e9f7ea9a83d3c05694d46
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs
'}]
commit_message:
Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of nova inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: Ia8687d49803705702f0e9f7ea9a83d3c05694d46
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-22 05:18:30.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/install-apt.yml'], 'message': 'Support other architectures in apt sources.list

The install-apt task of the bootstrap-host role obtains the apt
repository URL by performing an awk regex to match on "/ubuntu/".

Other architectures however, such as ppc64le, contain "/ubuntu-ports/"
in the URL which causes the regex to fail.

This patch modifies the awk regex to match any characters which exist
after "/ubuntu" and before the trailing "/".

Change-Id: I5417498dc89407edd642fd8f8fdce9745acb1759
'}]
commit_message:
Support other architectures in apt sources.list

The install-apt task of the bootstrap-host role obtains the apt
repository URL by performing an awk regex to match on "/ubuntu/".

Other architectures however, such as ppc64le, contain "/ubuntu-ports/"
in the URL which causes the regex to fail.

This patch modifies the awk regex to match any characters which exist
after "/ubuntu" and before the trailing "/".

Change-Id: I5417498dc89407edd642fd8f8fdce9745acb1759

commit_message:
force a git update of each repo we actually clone

In the CI system we may clone from a repo that doesn't have everything,
such as tags, so after zuul-cloner is done force an update to pull in
the tags.

Change-Id: Ic4b5a217ed142ff83555a0fececb424a1a400fc9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
split mistral-extra from mistral and fix validation

The mistral-extra repo is being deprecated. Split it out into its own
repository and mark it as not being released so we can ignore some of
the validation checks that now fail because of changes in
project-config.

commit_message:

concurrency issue happened during lb member adding/deleting.
More work is needed to further optimize the design, e.g. make

commit_message:
Add image number quota check

According to the blueprint "Support for basic quotas"[1], it's very
helpful for Glance to have the image number quota check. But it
didn't be achieved. This patch add a config item to limit the image
number for every user.

DocImpact

[1]: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/glance-basic-quotas

Closes-bug: #1520398
Change-Id: Ie03e3d14fc800ebe3e3233dd83e44182dd9e4dee

Currently 'qos-create' raises 500 InternalServerError if
you pass key or value greater than 255 characters. In the
database 'key' and 'value' fields has 255 characters of
maximum limit so if we pass more than that it raises DBError
and finally exits with 500 InternalServerError.

commit_message:
Fix 500 for 'qos-create' key or value > 255 characters

Currently 'qos-create' raises 500 InternalServerError if
you pass key or value greater than 255 characters. In the
database 'key' and 'value' fields has 255 characters of
maximum limit so if we pass more than that it raises DBError
and finally exits with 500 InternalServerError.

Renamed existing 'validate_extra_specs' from cinder.utils to
reduce code duplication and used it to validate both key and
value.

Change-Id: I35b59fd6fc6cbcbefb112ad5d3470b89641bd3d8
Closes-Bug: #1603325

commit_message:
Add min and max values to Float type and Opt

Just like Integers, Floats configuration should also have a minimum and
maximum possible values.
For example, the vmware-nsx plugin needs it for the QoS support.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/344763/

Change-Id: If1c47444e0c12b68d9d9cb645b8251e4462cfd49

subject: Minor updates might fail with missing MysqlClustercheckPassword property
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-06 09:16:10.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Minor updates might fail with missing MysqlClustercheckPassword property

With the fixes for the galera root password:
- python-tripleoclient: https://review.openstack.org/317542
- tripleo-heat-template: https://review.openstack.org/316297

we added the MysqlClustercheckPassword property which sets the password
for the clustercheck user. When a user runs a minor update via "openstack
overcloud update" he will get the following error:

    Property error: resources[1].properties: Property MysqlClustercheckPassword not assigned

This happens because the new property does not yet have a set value.
This new property is not set unless we do an "overcloud deploy", because
the tripleoclient code generating the passwords does not get invoked
during a minor update.

We want to make sure that it has a value set. It is not used during a
minor update in any case but heat does require it.

Since the process of fixing the galera root password requires a full
overcloud deploy command anyway, it is okay to give the
MysqlClustercheckPassword property a default empty value. Upgrades are
not affected because they do run a a full overcloud deploy command.

Closes-bug: #1598890

Change-Id: I4ab82e6fba08279b96e84c48e223262f656f1120
'}]
commit_message:
Minor updates might fail with missing MysqlClustercheckPassword property

With the fixes for the galera root password:
- python-tripleoclient: https://review.openstack.org/317542
- tripleo-heat-template: https://review.openstack.org/316297

we added the MysqlClustercheckPassword property which sets the password
for the clustercheck user. When a user runs a minor update via "openstack
overcloud update" he will get the following error:

    Property error: resources[1].properties: Property MysqlClustercheckPassword not assigned

This happens because the new property does not yet have a set value.
This new property is not set unless we do an "overcloud deploy", because
the tripleoclient code generating the passwords does not get invoked
during a minor update.

We want to make sure that it has a value set. It is not used during a
minor update in any case but heat does require it.

Since the process of fixing the galera root password requires a full
overcloud deploy command anyway, it is okay to give the
MysqlClustercheckPassword property a default empty value. Upgrades are
not affected because they do run a a full overcloud deploy command.

Closes-bug: #1598890

Change-Id: I4ab82e6fba08279b96e84c48e223262f656f1120

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-20 10:00:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': "Use real Neutron network for L3 GW by default

Relying on 'external_network_bridge=br-ex' for the L3
agent has been deprecated in Neutron. This patch adjusts
the devstack defaults to setup Neutron in the preferred
manner (empty external_network_bridge value and
correct bridge_mappings for the L2 agent).

This will also help with correct MTU calculations now that
the external network will have the correct segmentation
type on it ('flat' now instead of 'vxlan' by default).

Related-Bug: #1511578
Related-Bug: #1603493
Change-Id: Id20e67aba5dfd2044b82c700f41c6e648b529430
"}]
commit_message:
Use real Neutron network for L3 GW by default

Relying on 'external_network_bridge=br-ex' for the L3
agent has been deprecated in Neutron. This patch adjusts
the devstack defaults to setup Neutron in the preferred
manner (empty external_network_bridge value and
correct bridge_mappings for the L2 agent).

This will also help with correct MTU calculations now that
the external network will have the correct segmentation
type on it ('flat' now instead of 'vxlan' by default).

Related-Bug: #1511578
Related-Bug: #1603493

commit_message:
devstack: remove optional bridge configuration

Remove optional configuration of bridges through devstack.
This is no longer required since this commit, which readded automatic
bridge configuration by ODL when using vpnservice-openstack:
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/40918/

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-19 20:07:42.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/allow-admin-quota-operations-c1c2236711224023.yaml', 'cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_quotas.py', 'cinder/quota_utils.py'], 'message': "Allow admin project to operate on all quotas

Currently when operating on quotas in a nested
hierarchical environment, the calling project context
must be a member of the same hierarchy as the target
project in order to be authorized, even if it has the
admin role. This is a change in behavior for users who
are used to being able to view and modify any project
quotas as admin without needing a token scoped to the
target project's hierarchy.

This patch allows projects with the cloud admin role to
be able to operate on all project quotas regardless of
its place in project hierarchy.

Closes-bug: #1597045
Change-Id: Ifc0f1c5d06e7ca3aa7d9cf267a40f2a6b5cfc078
(cherry picked from commit a0a04f4332a609e854f2e67e3e9e9b723197b584)"}]
commit_message:
Allow admin project to operate on all quotas

Currently when operating on quotas in a nested
hierarchical environment, the calling project context
must be a member of the same hierarchy as the target
project in order to be authorized, even if it has the
admin role. This is a change in behavior for users who
are used to being able to view and modify any project
quotas as admin without needing a token scoped to the
target project's hierarchy.

This patch allows projects with the cloud admin role to
be able to operate on all project quotas regardless of
its place in project hierarchy.

Closes-bug: #1597045
Change-Id: Ifc0f1c5d06e7ca3aa7d9cf267a40f2a6b5cfc078
(cherry picked from commit a0a04f4332a609e854f2e67e3e9e9b723197b584)

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize common tasks

All of the common tasks shared across all of the playbooks have been
moved into "playbooks/common-tasks" as singular task files which are
simply included as needed.

* This change will assist developers adding additional playbooks, roles,
  etc which may need access to common tasks.

* This change will guarantee consistency between playbooks when
  executing common tasks which are generally used to setup services.

* This change greatly reduces code duplication across all plays.

* The common-task files have comments at the top for developer
  instructions on how a task file can be used.

Change-Id: I399211c139d6388ab56b97b809f93d4936907c7a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-21 20:18:00.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/hpe/test_hpe_3par_mediator.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_mediator.py'], 'message': 'HPE3PAR: Fix filestore quota decrement

HPE3PAR driver keeps a filestore fsquota to limit the space
available to all the nested shares. This fsquota should not
be decremented when read-only shares are removed. In this case
3PAR read-only shares are only used when the files exist in a
snapshot or in a read-write share. So the read-only share
itself does not hold any space. If a read-write share is
removed, then the decrement happens.

Change-Id: I1f006ce7e6cb2473f11b1505c1b7d4946aa5e1fc
Closes-Bug: #1599618
'}]
commit_message:
HPE3PAR: Fix filestore quota decrement

HPE3PAR driver keeps a filestore fsquota to limit the space
available to all the nested shares. This fsquota should not
be decremented when read-only shares are removed. In this case
3PAR read-only shares are only used when the files exist in a
snapshot or in a read-write share. So the read-only share
itself does not hold any space. If a read-write share is
removed, then the decrement happens.

Change-Id: I1f006ce7e6cb2473f11b1505c1b7d4946aa5e1fc
Closes-Bug: #1599618
